evidence: The Guardian reported that 30 to 40 people walked out of Sadowitz’s opening show, which featured “racism, sexism, homophobia and misogyny”.

question_sentence: This week marked the first anniversary of the Taliban’s return to power in Afghanistan. How many people evacuated the country in August last year?
evidence: US troops evacuated 113,500 people from the capital Kabul, while the UK evacuated 15,000 British nationals and Afghans.

question_sentence: Beachgoers in Britain were warned against swimming in the sea this week after what happened?
choices: A shark was spotted along the Cornish coastline
Water companies dumped sewage in the sea
evidence: Surfers Against Sewage identified around 50 unsafe swimming locations which had seen sewage dumped nearby as sewer systems were overwhelmed by rainfall.

question_sentence: What might become compulsory for cyclists under rumoured new laws?
evidence: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps is calling for a review of road rules for cyclists that could make it easier for police to identify riders of two-wheeled vehicles.

question_sentence: What type of aircraft, ordered this week by American Airlines, will reduce transatlantic flights to 3hr 30min?
evidence: American Airlines bet on ultra-fast transport this week by placing an order for 20 supersonic Overture jets. It’s expected that its first passengers will board in 2029.

question_sentence: A castaway on a desert island survived for five days on a diet of which three items?
evidence: Brazilian man Nelson Nedy was rescued after a jet skier noticed him waving his T-shirt in the air on Palmas island near Rio de Janeiro.

question_sentence: Due to the rising cost of living in the US, a growing number of people are fleeing their expensive cities in search of cheaper rent and a better quality of life abroad. Where are many Americans moving?
evidence: Mexico City has become a “work from home” haven for US expats, but locals say this is pricing them out.

question_sentence: What ancient find was uncovered in a Texas riverbed this week?
evidence: Dinosaur tracks from 113 million years ago were uncovered due to severe drought conditions at Dinosaur Valley State Park.

question_sentence: Which country debuted the world’s first hydrogen-powered passenger trains this week?
evidence: Germany launched emissions-free hydrogen passenger trains, with only steam and water issuing from the exhaust.

question_sentence: A British-Belgian teenager became the youngest person to fly around the world solo in a small aircraft. How old is he?
evidence: Seventeen-year-old Mack Rutherford set a world record Wednesday after landing in the Bulgarian capital of Sofia, where his journey began on March 23. He was just 15 when he received his pilot’s license.

question_sentence: Which member of the Biden administration tested positive for Covid-19 for the second time this month?
evidence: First lady Dr. Jill Biden tested positive for a rebound case of Covid-19 on Wednesday. Biden first tested positive on August 15 while vacationing in Kiawah Island, South Carolina.

question_sentence: Apple is expected to unveil a new generation of which popular product early next month?
evidence: Apple is expected to unveil the new iPhone 14 lineup at an event on September 7.

question_sentence: President Biden on Wednesday announced new student loan relief for millions of borrowers in the US. How much loan forgiveness will some eligible borrowers receive?
evidence: Individual borrowers who make less than $125,000 yearly and married couples or heads of households who make less than $250,000 yearly and also received a Pell grant as an undergraduate student will have up to $20,000 of their student loan debt forgiven.

question_sentence: Rents in the US recently hit a record high for the 17th month in a row. Which of the following US cities saw the biggest increase compared to a year ago?
evidence: Miami, where rents were up more than 26% from a year ago, saw the biggest increase among the 50 largest US cities for the 10th-straight month. Miami was followed by New York, Boston, Chicago, and Orlando, according to the latest market data.

question_sentence: Why were some Kia and Hyundai SUVs recalled this week?
evidence: Thousands of Hyundai Palisade and Kia Telluride vehicles made between 2020 and 2022 were recalled due to fire risks. Owners of these models should park their vehicles outside and away from homes until their cars are repaired, the US Department of Transportation said on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated show brought in a whopping 10 million viewers for its first episode this week?
evidence: HBO’s “House of the Dragon” – the “Game of Thrones” prequel – brought in roughly 10 million viewers for its first episode. It is the “largest audience for any new original series in the history of HBO,” according to the network. HBO, like CNN, is part of Warner Bros. Discovery.

question_sentence: HBO’s “House of the Dragon” was the network’s most watched series premiere ever, drawing nearly how many viewers?
Which MLB team’s owner announced this week that they have "initiated a formal process" that could result in selling the franchise?
NASA shared new James Webb Telescope images that show remarkable details of which planet?
According to an AccuWeather meteorologist, which airport set its new record for hourly rainfall overnight this week?
In his new series “The End is Nye,” Bill Nye said which movie “is so painfully close to what's happening right now”?
President Joe Biden announced a plan to wipe at least $10k in debt for millions of borrowers. What type of loans will be forgiven?
A teenager spent his summer making history: He became the youngest pilot to fly solo around the world. How old is Mack Rutherford?
Which tennis star announced that they won’t play at this year’s US Open?
As a last resort option, a Missouri school district approved a policy this summer to reinstate:
Dozens of people were killed in a Russian rocket strike on Ukraine's Independence Day this week. The countries have been at war for how long?
Which of the following investors has not been linked to a potential takeover of Manchester United amid protests by fans against current owners the Glazer family?
choices: Investor and Spurs owner Joe Lewis
Former Goldman Sachs executive Jim O’Neill
evidence: Around 10,000 Man Utd fans joined a march on Old Trafford this week to protest against the Florida-based Glazer family, who have saddled the club with huge debt

question_sentence: Student nurse Owami Davies was found after a seven-week search by Metropolitan Police during which officers received how many reported sightings?
evidence: Police said 24-year-old Davies appeared to be in ‘good health’ and was in ‘a place of safety’ after being found in Hampshire following a tip-off from a member of the public

question_sentence: Who was the star guest on the first episode of Meghan Markle’s newly launched Spotify podcast Archetypes?
evidence: Prince Harry also made a surprise cameo on the poorly reviewed debut episode, which focused on societal attitudes to female ambition

question_sentence: Criminal barristers protesting against cuts to pay and legal aid have voted to strike indefinitely from when?
evidence: The walkout is timed to coincide with the announcement of the new Tory leader and will result in the majority of crown court trials being adjourned in England and Wales

question_sentence: Which social media platform was the No.1 non-gaming app in the US Apple App Store this week after overtaking rivals including Facebook and Instagram?
evidence: The simultaneous photo-sharing app is designed to offer authentic snapshots of users’ daily lives and has been taking Gen Z by storm

question_sentence: China has announced plans to save drought-ravaged grain harvests by generating rain through a controversial technique called what?
evidence: The  weather modification technique involves spraying chemicals into clouds to induce rainfall. Beijing did not offer details about where and exactly how this might be done

question_sentence: Ukrainians this week celebrated Independence Day, which marks the date that the country officially split from the Soviet Union in which year?
evidence: Large-scale Independence Day celebrations were banned this year amid fears of further attacks by invading Russia forces. Instead, captured Russian military vehicles and tanks were paraded through Kyiv

question_sentence: Who has veteran broadcaster Emily Maitlis described as an ‘active Tory party agent’ at the BBC?
evidence: In a speech at the Edinburgh TV Festival, former Newsnight presenter Maitlis said BBC board member Gibb, who was Theresa May’s director of communications, was shaping the broadcaster’s output by acting as ‘the arbiter of BBC impartiality’

question_sentence: Elton John has collaborated with which US popstar on his new single, Hold Me Closer?
evidence: The song marks Spears’ return to music after winning her legal battle to be freed from her controversial conservatorship

question_sentence: This week’s GCSE results day revealed that pass grades have fallen from 79% last year to how much?
evidence: Although the pass rate fell from 2021, this year’s rate is up from 70% in 2019, when secondary school students in the UK last sat formal exams

question_sentence: Starbucks reintroduced one of its most popular drinks this week, commonly known as the “PSL.” What does “PSL” stand for?
evidence: Starbucks’ beloved Pumpkin Spice Latte is back – and at a slightly higher price. The PSL, as it’s often referred to, has been a popular item on Starbucks’ menu for nearly two decades, eliciting excitement among its loyal fan base.

question_sentence: Which state’s capital city is facing a water crisis after one of its water treatment plants failed?
evidence: The governor of Mississippi declared a state of emergency for Jackson, the state’s largest city, after its main water treatment facility failed, leaving residents without enough water to flush toilets or fight fires.

question_sentence: Which popular tourist destination was designated a “gun-free zone” this week?
evidence: People who carry firearms in Times Square’s new “gun-free zone” could be charged with a felony under a law that went into effect this week.

question_sentence: A Mickey Mantle baseball card from 1952 recently sold at auction for a jaw-dropping price, making it the most valuable sports collectible in the world. How much did the card sell for?
evidence: The baseball card sold for $12.6 million. Mantle spent 17 years playing for the New York Yankees and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1974. The card is especially valuable because it’s so well-preserved, according to Heritage Auctions.

question_sentence: In a recent major drug bust near the Texas-Mexico border, authorities seized more than $11 million worth of cocaine disguised as which household product?
evidence: An inspection near Laredo, Texas, revealed nearly 2,000 packages of baby wipes stuffed with more than 1,500 pounds of alleged cocaine.

question_sentence: Due to pressure from the Biden administration, what are some major airlines now offering to passengers when their flights are canceled?
evidence: Several major US airlines updated their customer service agreements this week to offer hotels and meals when flights are canceled. American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, United Airlines, JetBlue and Southwest have all published updates to their customer service policies this week.

question_sentence: Tennis star Serena Williams began what could be her final act this week by playing in which tournament?
evidence: Williams has been competing in thrilling matches at the US Open this week – reminding the world why she is one of the greatest tennis players of all time. She previously said these may be the final days of her storied career.

question_sentence: What percentage of the total US population is vaccinated against Covid-19?
evidence: About two-thirds of the total US population is vaccinated against Covid-19 with an initial series, according to data from the CDC. But less than half of those with their initial series – and less than a third of the total population – has also gotten a booster.

question_sentence: NASA was forced to reschedule its historic Artemis I launch on Monday due to a series of complications. Where is the mega rocket’s launchpad located?
evidence: The uncrewed Artemis I mission will get another attempt at launching on a journey around the moon on Saturday from Launchpad 39B at Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

question_sentence: According to a new estimate out this week, approximately how much does it cost to raise a child to the age of 17?
evidence: Thanks to inflation, it now costs more than $300,000 for a married middle-income couple with two children to raise their youngest child from birth through high school, according to a recent estimate from the Brookings Institution.

question_sentence: Serena Williams pulled off an upset of the No. 2 seed in the second round of the U.S. Open. Who did she defeat?
Who won artist of the year at Sunday’s MTV Video Music Awards?
Who was voted No. 1 in the “Top 100 players of 2022” by his peers in the NFL?
An extraordinary Justice Department court filing this week included a photograph that showed what on the floor of Mar-a-Lago?
An internet, TV, phone and energy company in Tennessee is launching an internet service the company says is how fast?
After 26 years alone, the last person to live in Brazil's Tanaru Indigenous Territory died this week. He was known as:
Twitter announced this week that it will be testing which new feature?
NASA's Artemis I launch was scrubbed this week over last-minute issues. Where was the rocket headed?
Even if the entire world stopped burning fossil fuels today, a new study says global sea levels will rise nearly a foot because of:
A Nebraska man claimed the world record for the "longest journey by a pumpkin boat" by paddling a 846-pound floating pumpkin down a river for:
Which Nobel Peace Prize-winning former world leader died this week, aged 91?
evidence: Awarded the prize in 1990 for his role in ending the Cold War, the last leader of the Soviet Union remained a divisive figure in Russia. He died in Moscow after a long illness.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new daily news podcast launched by former BBC stars Emily Maitlis, Jon Sopel and Lewis Goodall?
evidence: The new show was launched by BBC rival Global earlier this week.

question_sentence: How many UK workers from minority ethnic backgrounds have quit their jobs because of racism, according to a new survey?
evidence: According to a TUC survey of the UK’s 3.9m minority ethnic workers, more than one in four  said they had faced racist jokes at work in the last five years.

question_sentence: The Nasa mission that will return humans to the Moon for the first time in 50 years had to be postponed this week minutes before launch. What’s the name of the mission?
evidence: The first mission in the Artemis programme failed to launch after an engine cooling problem was identified. A second launch attempt will take place this weekend.

question_sentence: A letter made public this week revealed which Victorian author had campaigned for postal deliveries in their village to take place on Sundays?
evidence: The letter is now on display at the Charles Dickens Museum in London, and is one of 144 pieces of correspondence to have been added to the collection.

question_sentence: Donald Trump boasted he had “intelligence” on the sex life of which world leader, according to Rolling Stone magazine?
evidence: The magazine reported that the former US president claimed he had acquired illicit details of Macron’s “naughty ways” through “intelligence” he had seen or been briefed on.

question_sentence: This week marked the 25th anniversary of Princess Diana’s death. How many people lined the streets of London on the day of her funeral in 1997?
evidence: Unprecedented displays of public mourning were seen following Diana’s death, and 2.5 billion people worldwide reportedly tuned in to watch her funeral on TV.

question_sentence: Tory leadership frontrunner Liz Truss has said that the UK’s “experiment” with what hasn’t worked?
evidence: The leadership hopeful pledged to “review them and stop them, if they’re not working, as soon as possible” if she becomes the UK’s next prime minister on Monday.

question_sentence: The UK is facing a shortage of which festive crop?
evidence: The UK is facing a shortage of pumpkins as growers warn that poor weather has reduced their harvest by as much as a third. Experts said there will be a shortage of pumpkins for Halloween.

question_sentence: What is the estimated cost of the damage caused by devastating floods in Pakistan?
evidence: The planning minister in Pakistan said early estimates showed that flooding has caused at least $10bn (£8.5bn) worth of damage.

question_sentence: Liz Truss became the new prime minister of which country this week?
evidence: Liz Truss became the United Kingdom’s new prime minister on Tuesday, replacing her scandal-plagued predecessor Boris Johnson.

question_sentence: Which new treat did McDonald’s add to its menu for the fall?
evidence: Instead of introducing pumpkin or maple flavored menu items for the fall season, McDonald’s recently announced the return of a cheese danish. This treat is a flaky pastry filled with sweet cream cheese and was briefly served in the 1980s.

question_sentence: Legendary WNBA basketball player Sue Bird played her final game this week. Which team did she play for?
evidence: Sue Bird played her entire career with the Seattle Storm since 2002. She won four championships along with five selections to the All-WNBA first team and a record 12 All-Star Game appearances.

question_sentence: When will NASA next attempt to launch its massive new moon rocket, Artemis I?
evidence: It will be at least a few weeks before Artemis I can make its next launch attempt. The longer delay can be attributed to several factors, including quirks of scheduling, possible traffic at the launch site, and NASA’s desire to make sure it’s solved the latest issues with fuel leaks.

question_sentence: Which US Senate seat is most likely to flip in the midterm elections?
evidence: Pennsylvania, which President Biden narrowly won in 2020, remains the seat most likely to flip this fall, as Senate nominee Mehmet Oz and Democratic Lt. Gov. John Fetterman vie to replace retiring GOP Sen. Pat Toomey.

question_sentence: How much was Instagram fined this week for failing to protect children’s data?
evidence: Instagram was fined more than $400 million by Ireland’s data privacy regulator following an investigation into its handling of children’s data. The investigation, which started in 2020, focused on users between the ages of 13 and 17 who were allowed to operate business accounts, which facilitated the publication of their phone numbers and/or email addresses.

question_sentence: Which of the following US airports has been the worst for delays and cancellations this summer?
evidence: Chicago Midway International Airport has the highest percentage of flights delayed at 37.7%, according to the flight tracking site FlightAware. Other US airports with the highest number of cancellations are Baltimore/Washington International Airport and Orlando International Airport.

question_sentence: A new California fast-food law could soon raise the minimum wage to which hourly amount?
evidence: California’s governor signed into law a bill creating a “Fast Food Council” that could raise the minimum wage for fast food workers up to $22 an hour – well above the current $15 an hour amount.

question_sentence: Scientists say a so-called “doomsday glacier” could eventually raise sea level by several feet. Where is the glacier located?
evidence: Antarctica’s Thwaites glacier – nicknamed “the doomsday glacier” because of its high risk of collapse – has the potential to rapidly retreat in the coming years, scientists say, potentially raising sea level by several feet.

question_sentence: One of the biggest strikes in US history is brewing at which major company?
evidence: A high-stakes clash between one of America’s oldest unions and the world’s biggest package courier UPS is brewing. Major contract negotiations are set to expire in July 2023. Already, before the talks have even started though, labor experts are predicting that drivers and package handlers will go on strike.

question_sentence: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain’s longest-serving monarch, died Thursday. When did she ascend to the throne?
Francis Tiafoe continued his run at the U.S. Open this week, becoming the first American man to reach the tournament semifinals since:
Apple unveiled all these new products at its annual September event this week, except:
Coca-Cola discontinued which one of its products?
Which of these movies premiered at the Venice Film Festival this week?
Britain’s ruling Conservative Party chose Liz Truss as the country’s new prime minister. Who does she replace?
California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a new fast food law that gives fast food workers more power and protection, plus a starting pay of how much?
Pausing the DOJ's investigation into records seized from Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate, a federal judge approved Trump's request for:
choices: To declassify seized top secret documents
An expert witness on classified files
To release all his presidential records

question_sentence: Scientists deployed underwater robots in a first-of-its-kind mapping project to learn more about climate change. What are they focusing on?
President Joe Biden welcomed Barack and Michelle Obama back to the White House, reviving a tradition of hosting former presidents for:
choices: Picking the White House Christmas theme
Photo shoot in the Oval Office

question_sentence: King Charles III became Britain’s new monarch following the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. Who is next in the line of royal succession?
evidence: Prince William, who was named the Prince of Wales by his father, King Charles III, is first in line to the throne.

question_sentence: Which state has the most confirmed cases of monkeypox?
evidence: California has reported more than 4,300 monkeypox cases, the most out of any state. Earlier this week, the first US death due to monkeypox was also confirmed in Los Angeles County.

question_sentence: The 74th Emmy Awards were presented on Monday. Which show took home the award for outstanding drama series?
evidence: “Succession“ won the Emmy for outstanding drama series — the final award of the night. The show’s creator, Jesse Armstrong, caused a bit of a stir by taking a dig at King Charles III during his acceptance speech.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden delivered a highly anticipated speech this week on a “moonshot” initiative. Which ambitious goal did he announce?
choices: Reduce US cancer deaths by at least 50%
Land a woman on the moon by 2025
evidence: President Biden’s “moonshot” initiative aims to reduce cancer deaths in the US by at least 50% in the next 25 years. Biden – who lost his son to brain cancer – called the goal “completely doable” and said he would use his authority to increase funding for cancer research.

question_sentence: Rising inflation has driven food prices in the US far higher than they were a year ago. Which of the following grocery items has seen the biggest increase?
evidence: Egg prices have increased by nearly 40%, according to new data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Overall, grocery prices have jumped 13.5% since this time last year.

question_sentence: Which superstar athlete recently teased a potential return to competitive sports?
evidence: A little more than two weeks after she was knocked out of the US Open – a moment many thought would be the last act of her tennis career – Serena Williams has teased her potential return to the sport.

question_sentence: Legendary film director Jean-Luc Godard died at age 91 this week. Where did he revolutionize cinema in the late 1950s and 60s?
evidence: French President Emmanuel Macron tweeted a tribute to the director on Tuesday, writing that France has lost a “national treasure.”

question_sentence: Apple on Monday released its next-generation mobile software, iOS 16. Which highly anticipated feature did the company introduce to its iPhones?
evidence: Apple’s iOS 16 includes a new feature that allows users to edit and unsend recently sent iMessages. Users are also now able to personalize their iPhone lock screens.

question_sentence: Which Ivy League university recently acknowledged submitting inaccurate data for consideration in college rankings?
evidence: Columbia University said that it relied on “outdated and/or incorrect methodologies” in submitting data to U.S. News & World Report for consideration in the publication’s 2021 college rankings, according to a statement released by the university.

question_sentence: Which two countries are forging much closer economic ties since the war in Ukraine began?
evidence: Russia has been seeking to build closer ties with China after Europe and the United States responded to the invasion with waves of sanctions.

question_sentence: Carlos Alcaraz won the U.S. Open and became the first:
choices: Non-American male to win the tournament since 1995
Male Spanish player to win a major on a hardcourt
Teenage male to win a Grand Slam title since 1951

question_sentence: Twenty-two Republican governors sent a letter to President Joe Biden this week, calling on him to ditch plans for what?
Actor Ryan Reynolds revealed he underwent a potentially life-saving colonoscopy that revealed a polyp. Why did he get the screening?
choices: His wife shamed him on Twitter

question_sentence: A group of military experts across Russian TV admitted to the Kremlin's defeat in which Ukrainian region?
The governor of which state signed a bill that will require it to rank the extreme heat wave events?
When she died, Queen Elizabeth II left four dogs behind. Who will take care of Muick and Sandy, her two beloved Pembroke Welsh corgis?
choices: One for King Charles, one for Prince William
Prince Andrew and Duchess Sarah Ferguson

question_sentence: Monday’s Emmys featured tight competitions in several categories. Which show took home the award for best drama series?
USA TODAY celebrated a milestone anniversary this week. What year did the first issue hit newsstands?
The founder of which $3 billion outdoor retailer gave the company's ownership away to environmental trusts to fight climate change?
Roger Federer announced this week he will retire after the Laver Cup. Which Grand Slam tournament has the tennis legend won most?
More than a million people across Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic were without power or running water this week due to which hurricane?
evidence: Crews are working to repair critical utilities in the region disabled by Hurricane Fiona.

question_sentence: Britain bid farewell to Queen Elizabeth II with a grand funeral this week. In addition to her two corgi dogs, another one of the Queen’s beloved animals watched her procession. Which kind of animal was it?
evidence: Emma, the Queen’s pony, watched the procession pass by Windsor Castle.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden made a firm declaration about the Covid-19 pandemic this week. What did he say?
evidence: President Biden said he believes the Covid-19 pandemic is “over” in an appearance on CBS’ “60 Minutes,” but acknowledged the US still has a “problem” with the virus that has killed more than 1 million Americans.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 200,000 pickup trucks this week?
evidence: More than 200,000 Nissan pickup trucks were recalled due to a risk that the vehicles could roll away while in park. Nissan’s Frontier and Titan models from the years 2020 through 2023 are the affected vehicles, the company said.

question_sentence: Which WNBA team recently won its first championship title?
evidence: The Las Vegas Aces defeated the Connecticut Sun 78-71 in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals to capture their first title in franchise history.

question_sentence: Which Republican governor claimed credit for flying migrants to Martha’s Vineyard as part of his criticism of the Biden Administration’s immigration policies?
evidence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis defended his decision to transport 48 Venezuelan migrants to Martha’s Vineyard, Massachusetts, following the announcement of an investigation into the matter by a Texas sheriff.

question_sentence: According to the FAA, how many hours of flight experience are required before a pilot may work for an airline?
evidence: Pilots must have at least 1,500 hours of flight experience. Regional airline Republic Airways had asked the FAA to loosen commercial pilot hiring standards in order to tackle the global pilot shortage, but the request – which drew immense union opposition – was denied this week.

question_sentence: How many Russians could soon be conscripted into the country’s military?
evidence: President Vladimir Putin has announced the immediate “partial mobilization“ of Russian citizens in an escalation of Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. According to Russian officials, about 300,000 reservists will be called up as part of the mobilization.

question_sentence: Which social media platform banned political fundraising this week?
evidence: TikTok has begun to require “mandatory verification” for political accounts based in the United States and will be prohibiting all political fundraising on its short-video platform, the company said Wednesday.

question_sentence: Approximately how many book titles have been banned in US schools over the last year?
evidence: From July 2021 to June 2022, there were 2,532 book bans directed at 1,648 different titles in US schools. About 41% of those were books that tell stories related to LGBTQ people or that have a queer lead or prominent secondary character, according to a new report. Another 40% of the titles have main characters who are people of color, while 21% of titles directly address issues of race and racism, the report said.

question_sentence: The photo above, taken by the James Webb Space Telescope, shows which planet?
The COO of which company was arrested and accused of biting a man’s nose after a college football game?
What substance did Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers say is "not a drug"?
What fashion accessory was First Lady Jill Biden criticized for wearing to Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral?
choices: A fascinator instead of a hat

question_sentence: Who most recently agreed to meet with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol?
After more than two decades in prison, a judge vacated Adnan Syed's murder conviction. What podcast spawned investigations into Syed's case?
Federal officials said 47 people charged in a $250 mil. pandemic relief scam used the funds for luxury cars instead of what?
After a three-year investigation, New York's attorney general filed a $250 million lawsuit, accusing Donald Trump and three of his kids of what?
choices: Business fraud, inflating net worth for personal gain
Real estate fraud, misrepresenting property conditions

question_sentence: Why did it take the Mega Millions $1.34 billion winning ticket holders nearly two months to claim the jackpot?
choices: They were fighting over who bought it
They were out of the country

question_sentence: After knocking out all of Puerto Rico's power, what storm battered the island this week, causing mass floods and “catastrophic” damage?
Which public service broadcaster is likely to be saved from privatisation after a government U-turn on plans to sell it off?
evidence: Michelle Donelan, who recently replaced Nadine Dorries as culture secretary, has said the “business case” for selling Channel 4 will be re-examined and the sale put on hold.

question_sentence: Before this week’s ceremony for the Queen, for whom was the last state funeral in Britain held?
evidence: The most recent state funeral was for Winston Churchill in 1965. The last held for a sovereign was for the Queen’s father, George VI, in 1952. Both Princess Diana and former PM Thatcher were granted ceremonial, rather than state, funerals.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults are behind on one or more household bill, according to a new study?
evidence: Some 10.9m people are behind on one or more household bill – up by 3m since March – said the Money Advice Trust report. The Opinium survey also found 5.6m have gone without food in the past three months due to the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: The Queen’s state funeral was held in Westminster Abbey, but where was she finally laid to rest at a private ceremony attended by the Royal Family?
evidence: The late monarch was buried alongside the Duke of Edinburgh in the King George VI Memorial Chapel, part of St George’s Chapel. The public will be able to visit the chapel from next Thursday.

question_sentence: Which UK city has seen outbreaks of unrest after tensions have risen between young men from sections of the Muslim and Hindu communities?
evidence: Calm has returned to Leicester after a massive police operation was launched to quell unrest that has unsettled the east of the city for three weeks.

question_sentence: How many times in a row has the Bank of England now raised interest rates?
evidence: The Bank has increased its base rate by 0.5 points to 2.25%, the highest it has been since 2008.

question_sentence: Liz Truss has conceded that talks over a free trade deal with which major trading partner are unlikely to start in the “short to medium term”?
evidence: Once hailed as one of Brexit’s great prizes, Liz Truss said a free trade deal with the US will not be struck any time soon as she flew to New York on the first foreign trip of her premiership.

question_sentence: What percentage of Northern Ireland residents are Catholic, according to the latest census data?
evidence: Catholics are the largest religious group in Northern Ireland for the first time since partition. The country was designed to have a permanent Protestant, unionist majority, but larger Catholic families have changed the demographics.

question_sentence: What percentage of trainee GPs plan to work part-time after they qualify, according to a new study?
evidence: Almost two-thirds of trainee GPs plan to work part-time just a year after they qualify due to the stress and intensity of the job, according to a study by The King’s Fund.

question_sentence: Which UK brand found itself at the centre of a PR fiasco when it announced it would close for the Queen’s state funeral as a mark of respect?
evidence: Center Parcs announced that it would close its UK “villages” for the Queen’s funeral, “as a mark of our respect”. It sparked an angry backlash from holidaymakers kicked out of their holiday lodgings, forcing the company to backtrack.

question_sentence: NASA deliberately slammed a spacecraft into an asteroid this week to determine how to deflect space objects posing a threat to Earth. What was the name of the mission?
evidence: NASA’s DART mission – or Double Asteroid Redirection Test – was the agency’s first full-scale demonstration of deflection technology that can protect the planet.

question_sentence: Approximately how many customers in Florida were without power Thursday due to Hurricane Ian?
evidence: More than 2.5 million residences and businesses were without power in Florida on Thursday. “Ian is going to be a life-changing event. This is a very powerful, catastrophic storm that is going to do significant damage,” said Eric Silagy, CEO of Florida Power & Light.

question_sentence: Many Americans likely shell out more money to keep their homes warm this winter due to what?
evidence: Energy prices are on the rise in part because heat waves this summer forced utilities to draw down on their natural gas reserves, compounding the strain on inventory levels that were already below historical averages.

question_sentence: Giorgia Meloni claimed victory this week to become which country’s new prime minister?
evidence: A 45-year-old mother from Rome, Giorgia Meloni will become Italy’s most far-right prime minister since the fascist era of Benito Mussolini. Meloni is deeply conservative, openly anti-LGBTQ, and has also called abortion a “tragedy,” raising fears for the future of women’s rights in the country.

question_sentence: Which pop star will perform at next year’s Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show?
evidence: Rihanna will headline the 2023 Super Bowl Halftime Show, the NFL announced. The 57th Super Bowl will take place on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona.

question_sentence: Which airline was named the world’s best for 2022?
evidence: This year’s winner, Qatar Airways, has received the top prize seven times since the Skytrax World Airline Awards were introduced in 1999. Skytrax, a UK-based airline and airport review and ranking site, conducted more than 14 million customer surveys in more than 100 countries to find out the world’s current best airline.

question_sentence: Which currency recently plummeted to a record low against the US dollar?
evidence: The British pound plunged nearly 5% on Monday to just above $1.03 on growing fears about the stability of the UK government’s finances.

question_sentence: Which Major League Baseball team was invited to a celebration at the White House this week?
evidence: The Atlanta Braves were invited to the White House on Monday to celebrate their 2021 World Series win. Check out photos from the event here and see the jersey they gifted to President Biden.

question_sentence: Which new character did M&M’s add to the brand’s lineup this week?
evidence: The brand said the addition of the purple character is to “reflect the world that we’re living in.” The purple peanut M&M is the first new character in 10 years, according to the brand.

question_sentence: NBA star LeBron James has agreed to buy a team in which major sports league?
evidence: NBA superstar LeBron James is expanding his sports portfolio to include the US’ new favorite pastime: Pickleball.

question_sentence: More than 1,000 students walked out of Virginia middle and high schools this week in protest of what?
American Hans Niemann was accused of cheating in competition by five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen. What sport do they play?
Out of 200 purebred dog breeds recognized by the American Kennel Club, which was the most searched in the U.S., according to Google data?
Costco’s CFO said the store’s snack bar will keep the current price of its famous hot dog and soda combo maybe “forever.” How much is it?
Referendums dismissed by the West as "shams" in Russian-held regions in Ukraine were held in this week. Which is not one of those areas?
The headliner for the Super Bowl halftime show in February was announced this week. Who will be performing?
Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill into law that gives Californians a new end-of-life burial option. What is it?
As part of a groundbreaking planetary defense test, NASA crashed a spacecraft into what?
Which restaurant chain has an index that's been used to predict how severely natural disasters – like Hurricane Ian – will affect an area?
With his 61st home run, which New York Yankees star tied Roger Maris' American League record for most homers in a season this week?
What is the name of the category 4 hurricane that has left a trail of destruction in Florida?
evidence: Hurricane Ian has brought damaging winds and storm surges to the Florida coast, leading to severe flooding. More than two million residents have been left without electricity.

question_sentence: In which country has Edward Snowden been granted citizenship, nine years after fleeing the US where he is wanted on spying charges?
evidence: The whistleblower has lived in Moscow for nine years since fleeing the US, and was given permanent residency in 2020. He was one of 72 foreigners granted a passport this week in a decree signed by President Vladimir Putin.

question_sentence: What percentage of Britons believe they could win a fight against a chimpanzee, according to a YouGov poll?
evidence: Researchers asked people in Britain and America whether they felt they could overcome 15 animals, wild and domestic. Among Americans 17% believe they would win in a fight against a chimpanzee.

question_sentence: Which nation has become the latest to legalise same-sex marriage after a referendum?
evidence: Cubans voted in favour of a family code that increases protections for minorities on the island. Same-sex couples also now have the right to adopt children.

question_sentence: How many miles from Earth was the asteroid that Nasa successfully crashed a spacecraft into this week as part of a planetary defence test?
evidence: The ten-month $325m mission, known as  Dart (Double Asteroid Redirection Test), was the first attempt to shift the position of an asteroid or any other natural object in space.

question_sentence: Roger Federer retired from top-flight tennis this week after an illustrious career in which he won how many Grand Slam singles titles?
evidence: The Swiss great, aged 41, announced that last weekend’s Laver Cup in London would mark his final competitive appearance.

question_sentence: Who plays Boris Johnson in This England, a new six-part TV series﻿ chronicling the former prime minister’s premiership?
evidence: Kenneth Branagh dons a wig and prosthetics to portray the former PM in Michael Winterbottom’s Sky Atlantic series.

question_sentence: A petition has been started to rid Prince William and his wife Catherine of which of their titles?
evidence: A petition calling for the title of Prince of Wales to be scrapped “out of respect for Wales” has been gathering pace, gaining more than 35,000 signatures over the past three weeks.

question_sentence: How many sheep did a British woman shear in eight hours to set a new world record?
evidence: Marie Prebble, 34, whose family has farmed in Kent for centuries, sheared one strong wool lamb every 90 seconds, equivalent to more than 46 an hour, to claim the first record for a woman.

question_sentence: In which UK city is this year’s Conservative Party conference about to take place?
evidence: The Tory conference comes amid discontent among the party’s backbench MPs due to the market chaos that has emerged in the wake of Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng’s mini-budget last week.

question_sentence: Which airline announced it is suspending service at New York’s JFK Airport, saying its schedule is too small to remain competitive?
evidence: United Airlines is temporarily halting service at JFK beginning October 29, the company announced.

question_sentence: Which new product did Tesla debut at an event this week?
evidence: Tesla’s new robot, dubbed Optimus, walked on stage at the company’s AI Day, slowly waved at the crowd and gestured with its hands for about one minute.

question_sentence: The devastation wrought by Hurricane Ian likely caused how much in damages?
evidence: Initial damages from the deadly storm are estimated to be more than $50 billion – and also dinged overall US economic output, economists say.

question_sentence: An independent investigation released this week found systemic abuse and misconduct within which women’s professional sport in the US?
evidence: The investigation found multiple allegations or findings of sexual harassment and misconduct by head coaches of several women’s professional soccer teams.

question_sentence: SpaceX and NASA launched a rocket into space Wednesday. What was its destination?
evidence: SpaceX and NASA launched a crew of astronauts to the International Space Station. The mission marks a significant moment in history, as astronaut Nicole Mann became the first Native American woman ever to travel to space. She’s also serving as mission commander, making her the first woman ever to take on such a role for a SpaceX mission.

question_sentence: Beloved singer Loretta Lynn died this week at age 90. Which music genre was she best known for?
evidence: Loretta Lynn, the “Coal Miner’s Daughter,” scored several hits with fiery country songs that topped the charts in 1966.

question_sentence: New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hit a record-breaking 62nd home run this week. Who holds the overall major league single-season record with 73 home runs?
evidence: While Judge broke Roger Maris’ single-season American League home run record, Barry Bonds holds the major league record with 73 home runs in 2001. However, many have cast doubt on that landmark given that Bonds was embroiled in a performance-enhancing drug scandal and allegedly used steroids. Bonds has denied those allegations.

question_sentence: Which country announced a new plan this week to prevent any more animal species from reaching extinction?
evidence: Australia, which has one of the world’s worst records for extinctions, has committed to protecting 30% of its land and 30% of its ocean by 2030.

question_sentence: Which state announced it is legalizing jaywalking?
evidence: Californians will soon be able to cross the street outside of a formal intersection without being ticketed – as long as it’s safe to do so. The new law signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom will take effect on January 1.

question_sentence: Which country’s polarizing presidential race will go to a second round run-off after no candidate achieved a majority of more than 50% of the ballot this week?
evidence: Brazil’s heated presidential election will go to second round. This comes after more than 123 million Brazilians waited in long lines to vote in the world’s fourth largest democracy.

question_sentence: Aaron Judge hit his 62nd home run of the season this week, breaking a 61-year-old American League record previously held by:
Native American activist and actress Sacheen Littlefeather died this week. She famously declined an Oscar on behalf of which actor?
A new character was added to the M&Ms lineup for the first time in over a decade. What color is she?
In a historic move, President Joe Biden announced he is pardoning people with federal convictions for what charge?
To celebrate the 60th anniversary of a major single, two previously unseen photos of what iconic band were released this week?
A pumpkin in which state set a new record as the heaviest in US history?
The rapper formerly known as Kanye West made a big statement at Paris Fashion Week. What was on his clothing that sparked backlash?
An angry mob of anglers was seen on viral video assailing two men who tried to cheat at a fishing tournament by doing what?
choices: Stocking the lake ahead of time

question_sentence: Guinness World Records named Fenrir Antares Powers, a 2-year-old Savannah cat, the tallest living domestic cat. He measures:
Loretta Lynn, a Kentucky coal miner’s daughter who became a country music legend, died this week at 90. Which of these is not one of her songs?
choices: "You Ain't Woman Enough (To Take My Man)"

question_sentence: Greenpeace campaigners who disrupted Liz Truss’s Tory conference speech held a sign saying what?
evidence: The protesters accused the prime minister of “shredding” her party’s election manifesto by U-turning on fracking and climate action

question_sentence: A first edition of which Jane Austen novel sold for £375,000 at auction this week?
evidence: Published in 1815, the three-volumn edition of Emma includes a handwritten message from Austen and achieved the highest price ever paid for any printed work by the author

question_sentence: The newly launched European Political Community is the brainchild of which national leader?
evidence: Leaders from 44 countries – including all 27 EU member states – met in Prague this week for the first summit of the new political forum of nations

question_sentence: North Korea this week test-fired a ballistic missile over which country for the first time since 2017?
evidence: Pyongyang triggered panic on Tuesday by firing an intermediate-range missile an estimated 4,600km (2,860 miles) over Japan into the Pacific Sea, in the first test launch over the enemy nation in five years

question_sentence: Academics have criticised Steve Coogan’s new film The Lost King for allegedly doing what?
choices: Being filmed in historically inaccurate locations
Mixing up the dates of Richard III’s reign
Overplaying the work of an amateur historian
evidence: Academics involved in the discovery of King Richard III’s remains in a Leicester car park in 2012 claim the film gives too much credit to Philippa Langley, a history buff who became obsessed with finding the lost monarch

question_sentence: Kanye West sparked controversy this week by doing what at Paris Fashion Week?
choices: Publicly propositioning his ex-mother-in-law, Kris Jenner
Announcing his candidacy in the US presidential election in 2024
Kissing model Kendall Jenner, the sister of his ex Kim Kardashian
evidence: The rapper and designer is facing criticism for wearing the controversial T-shirt and sending black models down the runway in clothing bearing the slogan at his Yeezy label fashion show

question_sentence: Which of the following are among six high-profile figures taking legal action against the Daily Mail’s publisher over what they describe as ‘gross breaches of privacy’?
evidence: Prince Harry, Doreen Lawrence, Sadie Frost, Elton John and his partner David Furnish are also taking legal action against Associated Newspapers over alleged phone-tapping and privacy breaches

question_sentence: Which Asian destination is giving away 500,000 free airline tickets in a bid to boost tourism following the pandemic?
evidence: Hong Kong authorities are giving away HK$2bn (£224.3m) worth of flights as part of a push to increase visitor numbers to pre-Covid levels

question_sentence: A new study has suggested that images posted on Instagram are causing new mothers extra stress by doing what?
choices: Pushing breast feeding as the only option
evidence: The study, published in the journal Healthcare, found new mothers’ mental health could be at risk due to unrealistic images of postpartum bodies

question_sentence: King Charles has reportedly been asked by Liz Truss not to attend this year’s Cop27 climate conference, which is being held where?
evidence: Alok Sharmer, president of last year’s summit, has urged Truss to allow the King to attend the summit with her next month,  following reports that the prime minister had advised Charles to stay away

question_sentence: How much plastic in the US is actually recycled, according to the Environmental Protection Agency?
evidence: Only 9% of plastic in the US is recycled – and that includes the items you threw into the recycle bin, the EPA says. The plastic industry is responsible for the same annual emissions as around 50 million cars, and more plastic-making facilities continue to come online.

question_sentence: Which fast food chain has the slowest drive-thru, according to a new study?
evidence: A recent study showed Chick-fil-A had the slowest drive-thru among major fast-food chains – but only because it’s so popular and there are so many cars in line.

question_sentence: A volcano erupted on which European island this week?
evidence: A volcano erupted on the Italian island of Stromboli. Watch video of the moment here.

question_sentence: Which high-profile individual’s Twitter account was locked this week for posting an offensive message?
evidence: Twitter locked Kanye West’s account for violating the company’s policies over an antisemitic tweet.

question_sentence: Which university recently issued an apology after it sent out 4,000 acceptance letters by mistake?
evidence: Northeastern University’s law school mistakenly sent out 4,000 acceptance letters, the school said in a statement. Admissions decisions are not expected to be finalized until later in the academic year.

question_sentence: Which professional golfer clinched the controversial LIV Golf championship and the $18 million prize?
evidence: Dustin Johnson has enough points to secure the inaugural LIV Golf championship and the series’ $18 million prize, LIV officials announced Monday. The controversial competition has caused a rift in professional golf, as LIV golfers have been banned from the PGA Tour for participating in the breakaway series.

question_sentence: President Biden designated Camp Hale — a WWII-era training ground — as a new national monument this week. Where is it located?
evidence: The President signed a proclamation establishing the 53,804-acre site high in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado as a national monument. He also moved to pause new mineral, oil and gas leasing in the protected area.

question_sentence: NASA has set a date for another try at launching its Artemis I moon mission. How soon could the attempt occur?
evidence: After Hurricane Ian forced NASA to roll back the massive rocket into its hangar at Kennedy Space Center in Florida last month, a new launch window has now been set to open on November 14. If the launch is successful, the rocket will send the uncrewed Orion spacecraft around the moon and back to earth.

question_sentence: According to the Justice Department, about how many pages of documents were seized in the FBI’s search of former President Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort?
evidence: The DOJ says just over 21,000 pages were taken from Trump’s Mar-a-Lago residence during the FBI search in August – far fewer than the 200,000 pages Trump’s legal team had claimed.

question_sentence: Which band announced this week it’s dropping a new single and will reunite for a tour?
evidence: Blink-182 is coming to a city near you. Band members Travis Barker and Mark Hoppus are set to reunite with original member, Tom DeLonge for the tours.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden designated his first national monument this week. What state it is located in?
A MLB umpiring crew notably checked which part of San Diego Padres pitcher Joe Musgrove for foreign substances?
According to a new study, which of these fast food restaurants has the slowest drive-thru?
Star of stage and screen, veteran actress Angela Lansbury died this week at 96. Which one of these was she not involved with?
Which of these bands announced this week they were reuniting with all the original members?
How much money did a jury decide conspiracy theorist Alex Jones should pay over his false claims that the Sandy Hook shooting was a hoax?
Which of these NFL head coaches was fired this week, becoming the first to be let go this season?
Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk’s latest financial venture? A new perfume – with a peculiar name. What is it called?
Texas Pete hot sauce is facing a class action lawsuit after a man learned the product isn't made in Texas. Where is it actually made?
A chihuahua named TobyKeith regained his Guinness World Records title of the world’s oldest living dog. How old is he?
Dame Angela Lansbury died this week following an 80-year acting career during which she bagged her first Oscar nomination for which film?
evidence: The star, who passed away at the age of 96, was nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her first-ever film role, as a maid in Gaslight. She went on to secure two further Oscar nominations and received an Honorary Academy Award in 2013

question_sentence: Buckingham Palace has announced that King Charles’s coronation will take place on what date?
evidence: The King and his wife, Queen Consort Camilla, will be crowned in a ceremony at Westminster Abbey that is expected to be a ‘scaled-back’ affair that ‘takes into account the straitened times in which Britain finds itself’, said the FT

question_sentence: Which country is planning to tax farmers for the greenhouse gas emissions from their cows’ burps and farts?
evidence: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern hopes to combat climate change by making farmers pay for their livestock’s emissions from 2025. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Sales of which of the following products are soaring as consumers look to cut their energy costs, according to latest British Retail Consortium data?
evidence: Air fryers, blankets and warm clothing were among the products being snapped up by consumers last month amid rising fears about soaring energy bills this winter

question_sentence: The public spending watchdog is to investigate the £120m ‘Festival of Brexit’, which included a 35-metre-tall interactive art installation dubbed ‘See Monster’ in which seaside town?
evidence: The See Monster, a revamped former oil rig, was one of ten projects commissioned for the festival, which achieved only a tiny percentage of the 66m visitors target

question_sentence: Keir Starmer has put the Labour Party on an ‘election footing’ by sacking which member of his top team?
evidence: Starmer told staff that the team changes were part of a wider restructure aimed at putting Labour in position to seize power at the next general election. The ‘government’s collapse has given us a huge chance’, he reportedly added

question_sentence: Which charity has said it is ‘not ruling out’ direct action to defend against government policies that are an ‘attack on nature’?
evidence: Beccy Speight, CEO of the bird protection charity, warned that the government’s growth policies will endanger natural habitats and wildlife. She told the BBC that ‘all options’, including direct action and marches, were under consideration

question_sentence: Comments by which cabinet minister have put the UK’s trade deal with India on the ‘verge of collapse’, according to reports?
evidence: Indian ministers reacted with fury after the home secretary told The Spectator that she had ‘concerns’ about the trade deal and criticised migrants from their country

question_sentence: What percentage of the more than 600m people who have had Covid-19 subsequently developed long Covid, according to World Health Organization estimates?
evidence: WHO boss Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has urged governments to tackle the ‘very serious’ crisis of Covid survivors suffering mid- and long-term symptoms such as fatigue, breathlessness and cognitive dysfunction

question_sentence: More than 350 bars are taking part in London Cocktail Week, which is running for how long?
evidence: The misleadingly named event runs from 13 to 23 October, with popular drinking spots across the English capital offering discounted cocktails, mixology classes and more

question_sentence: Groundbreaking movie star Anna May Wong will be the first Asian American featured on the back of which US currency?
evidence: Anna May Wong will be featured on the back of new quarters. The coin design is the fifth to emerge from the American Women Quarters Program, which highlights pioneering women in their respective fields.

question_sentence: The Biden administration launched a new website this week that allows millions of eligible federal student loan borrowers to apply for up to how much debt forgiveness?
evidence: Eligible borrowers can now apply for up to $20,000 in debt forgiveness at StudentAid.gov.

question_sentence: Girl Scouts of the USA received its largest ever donation from a single donor this week. Which philanthropist contributed more than $80 million to the organization?
evidence: Girl Scouts of the USA received a gift of $84.5 million from MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.

question_sentence: Which two major supermarkets plan to merge in 2024?
evidence: In a mega-deal that could have a huge impact on grocery shopping in America, Kroger and Albertsons announced plans to merge next year in a nearly $25 billion deal.

question_sentence: Kanye West, who legally changed his name to Ye, announced he is acquiring which controversial social media platform?
evidence: Kanye West is acquiring Parler, the alternative social media platform favored by many conservatives. The acquisition comes after Ye had his account temporarily locked by Twitter this month over an antisemitic tweet.

question_sentence: Which country saw its prime minister resign this week?
evidence: Liz Truss resigned as Britain’s prime minister after a disastrous six-week tenure. This makes Truss the UK’s shortest-serving leader ever.

question_sentence: As of this week, which item can US adults now purchase without first seeing a health care professional or needing a prescription?
evidence: For the first time, adults can buy over-the-counter hearing aids instead of getting a prescription and having to wait for a custom fitting.

question_sentence: Which major city opened a makeshift tent camp this week to house hundreds of migrants bused there from the southern border?
evidence: With the arrival of migrant buses showing no sign of slowing, officials in New York City constructed a tent camp to house hundreds of migrants.

question_sentence: Approximately how many people have been arrested during the current protests in Iran?
evidence: More than 1,000 people have been arrested in the country as many Iranians continue to rise up against decades of repression, according to state media IRNA.

question_sentence: Which is the most popular Halloween costume this year, according to Google ratings?
evidence: It looks like Americans are sticking to what they know this Halloween. The top costume this year is a witch, with Spider-Man snagging the second spot.

question_sentence: Spirit Airlines shareholders approved a $3.8 billion merger with which company?
James Corden was briefly banned by restaurateur Keith McNally for Corden’s alleged poor behavior at which restaurant?
Which car company unveiled its first fully-electric vehicle this week?
What happened when a fan who won a Washington Commanders 50/50 raffle tried to cash the $14,822 check?
choices: It got stuck in the ATM

question_sentence: Moviegoers reported fainting and vomiting in movie theaters while seeing which newly-released horror film?
Google released a list of the year's most popular Halloween costumes. Which spooky getup topped the list?
Which trailblazing Chinese American actress will be the first Asian American person to be featured on the U.S. quarter?
More than 1,000 of which item left in tribute to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be donated to a children’s charity?
British Prime Minister Liz Truss resigned from her post after how many days in office?
McDonald’s will begin testing a partnership at some locations that will allow it to sell food from:
Liz Truss resigned as prime minister after how many days in office?
evidence: The outgoing Tory leader will go down in history as the shortest-serving British PM, after taking office on 6 September and announcing that she was standing down on 20 October.

question_sentence: Just Stop Oil activists hurled tomato soup at Vincent van Gogh’s Sunflowers in which London gallery?
evidence: Climate protesters Phoebe Plummer, 21, and Anna Holland, 20, both pleaded not guilty to criminal damage at Westminster Magistrates’ Court after throwing two cans of soup over the painting, worth an estimated £72m.

question_sentence: Which service station has been named Britain’s worst in a poll of 31,000 motorists?
evidence: The service station was named the worst in a survey by Transport Focus, with satisfaction levels of just 80%. Only three-quarters of visitors were happy with its toilet facilities.

question_sentence: With Liz Truss’s successor as Tory leader about to be chosen, what year is the latest the next general election could take place?
evidence: The current Parliament is set to be automatically dissolved on 17 December 2024, five years after it first met. Polling would then take place 25 days later, meaning the latest the next general election could be held would be January 2025.

question_sentence: Which formidable but controversial tabloid newspaper editor was seemingly snubbed for a peerage this week?
evidence: Dacre, editor-in-chief of Daily Mail publisher DMG Media, failed to appear on Boris Johnson’s political honours list following legal action against the newspaper group.

question_sentence: Which British luxury carmaker revealed its first fully electric vehicle this week?
evidence: The Rolls-Royce Spectre EV marks the first step towards achieving the British company’s pledge to have an all-electric line-up by 2030.

question_sentence: Which English rugby union club went into administration this week?
evidence: Wasps have made 167 players and staff redundant after becoming the second Premiership club to go into administration in 21 days, following the demise of Worcester Warriors.

question_sentence: What did Health Secretary Thérèse Coffey come under fire for admitting to this week?
evidence: Thorrun Govind, of the Royal Pharmaceutical Society, said Coffey’s admission had “undermined the great work of healthcare colleagues working hard to prevent antibiotic resistance”.

question_sentence: Who won the Mercury Prize for the best British or Irish album of the last 12 months?
evidence: The British rapper took the £25,000 award for her fourth album Sometimes I Might Be Introvert, described by the BBC as a “hip-hop coming-of-age tale delivered with a cinematic sweep”.

question_sentence: Which news presenter has been suspended after they were recorded using a four-letter expletive to describe a government minister?
evidence: The Channel 4 News presenter has apologised for using an offensive insult about Steve Baker after interviewing him following the departure of Suella Braverman as home secretary.

question_sentence: Which virus is spreading at unusually high levels and overwhelming children’s hospitals in the US?
evidence: Hospitals across the US say they are being overwhelmed by a common respiratory virus known as RSV. As a result, pediatric hospital beds are more full now than they have been in the past two years, according to a CNN analysis.

question_sentence: Hurricane Roslyn made landfall in which country this week?
evidence: Hurricane Roslyn flooded roads and damaged buildings along Mexico’s Pacific coast with sustained winds of 120 mph.

question_sentence: Which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: Diwali, one of the most important festivals in Hinduism, began this week with colorful customs and celebrations. The holiday also has significance for Sikhs and Jains, and is celebrated not just in India, but in Nepal, Malaysia, Singapore and other countries with South Asian diasporas.

question_sentence: Who became the new prime minister of the United Kingdom this week?
evidence: Rishi Sunak officially took over as Britain’s Prime Minister, becoming the country’s third leader in seven weeks.

question_sentence: What percentage of Ukraine’s wind energy infrastructure has been destroyed during its war with Russia?
evidence: More than 90% of Ukraine’s wind energy infrastructure has been destroyed due to Russian attacks, according to a Ukrainian official.

question_sentence: Due to an increase in bots on its site, which platform said it is rolling out new features to help users spot fake accounts?
evidence: While often thought of as a tamer social platform for professionals and job seekers, LinkedIn is not immune to inauthentic behavior. The company said it is rolling out new features to detect sophisticated bad actors.

question_sentence: Which late Supreme Court Justice will be featured on a new US postage stamp in 2023?
evidence: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, a longtime liberal member of the high court who died at age 87 in 2020, will be featured on a forever stamp, the US Postal Service announced Monday.

question_sentence: Which company announced it is shutting down its efforts to develop self-driving cars?
evidence: Ford is pulling the plug on an effort to develop its first fully self-driving car, and it’s going to cost the automaker $2.7 billion to walk away.

question_sentence: Former defense secretary Ash Carter died at 68 this week, his family said. Which president did he serve under?
evidence: Carter led the Defense Department under former President Barack Obama from February 2015 to January 2017.

question_sentence: Corporate America is canceling Kanye West. Among the companies that cut ties with the rapper, which one cost him the most money — and his status as a billionaire?
evidence: West’s Adidas deal accounted for $1.5 billion of his net worth but after his falling out with the company due to his antisemitic comments, Forbes now estimates West’s net worth is $400 million.

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak was selected prime minister by Britain's Conservative Party this week. How many people have held that office in the last six years?
Pest control company Orkin ranked the most mice-and-rat-infested metropolitan regions in the U.S. Which city isn't in the top 10?
The Philadelphia Phillies are back in the World Series this week for the first time since:
Which of these filmmakers was named a co-chairman and CEO of the newly formed DC Studios?
The founder of which company is giving their business away, saying “wealth is a curse”?
A photo of a dad who came directly from work to join his son at a Kentucky Wildcats basketball game went viral. What does he do for a living?
Climate activists in Europe again threw food at fine art in protest of fossil fuels. What was splattered on glass protecting a Monet painting?
Beloved Emmy-winning actor Leslie Jordan, 67, was found dead in his car following a crash this week. He had a role in all of these except:
Three Florida men were charged with stealing millions of dollars worth of what product from across the Midwest?
After show producers spotted his macabre, yet hilarious videos, a Kentucky man known for playing "dead" on TikTok was cast on which show?
Rishi Sunak attended which elite private school?
evidence: The £45,000-a-year school has produced six chancellors of the Exchequer and now two prime ministers.

question_sentence: A 2013 poll found the Ford Fiesta was the most popular car to have what in, according to The Sun?
evidence: Ford has confirmed it will end production of the UK’s all-time bestselling car next June.

question_sentence: What is the name of Rishi Sunak’s family dog?
evidence: The fox red labrador retriever will be the latest famous pet to live at No. 10, joining “chief mouser” Larry the Cat.

question_sentence: What animal has been born in the wild in the UK for the first time in 6,000 years?
evidence: The calf was spotted by two rangers in a Kent woodland, where three female bison – none of which were known to be pregnant – were introduced in July as part of a rewilding project.

question_sentence: Which high street supermarket is threatening to permanently close its flagship London store if it is not allowed to demolish and rebuild it?
evidence: M&S, which has had a difficult few years, said it was “unsustainable” to continue trading on its current Oxford Street site. But the demolition plan has prompted fierce opposition and a public inquiry is under way.

question_sentence: Bob Geldof criticised the use of what term when speaking to Radio Times this week?
evidence: The former pop star, who organised the Live Aid concert that helped raise £150m for famine relief, said: “Black saviours, white saviours, green saviours, I’m with them all.”

question_sentence: The average cost of a pint in the UK could rise to what price, according to a top brewer?
evidence: Alan Mahon, chief executive of Brewgooder, said the cost of  ingredients such as wheat and barley were rising faster than the rate of inflation, and energy prices are reaching “eye-watering levels”.

question_sentence: What did US President Joe Biden say was a “legitimate concern” for voters ahead of the US midterm elections?
evidence: Biden is expected to run for re-election in 2024 and would be 86 if he completed a second term. He admitted in an interview he could “drop dead tomorrow”.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK schools are expected to run out of money by next year?
evidence: Nine out of ten schools will have run out of money by the next school year as the “enormous burden” of increased energy bills and salaries “takes its toll”, reported The Observer this week.

question_sentence: Which rock ’n’ roll megastar was erroneously reported dead this week?
evidence: TMZ initially claimed that Lewis, 87, had died at home in Memphis. But Lewis’s representative later told Page Six: “He’s alive. TMZ reported erroneously off of a bulls*** anonymous tip.”

question_sentence: Which social media platform is considering charging for verified accounts on its site?
evidence: Twitter is considering a pay-for-verification feature that would give the coveted blue check marks only to users who are willing to pay $8 a month for a subscription service.

question_sentence: Which city this week agreed to pay $26 million to two men wrongly convicted of Malcolm X’s murder?
evidence: The 2020 Netflix documentary “Who Killed Malcolm X?” drew major attention to the case. Now, more than two years later, New York City agreed to pay a multimillion-dollar settlement to two men whose convictions in the 1965 assassination of Malcolm X were thrown out last November.

question_sentence: In addition to Halloween, which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: The Mexican holiday Día de los Muertos, also known as the Day of the Dead, extends over the first two days of November and was celebrated this week with colorful traditions to honor deceased loved ones.

question_sentence: A no-hitter was thrown this week for just the second time in World Series history. Which two teams are competing in Major League Baseball’s championship?
evidence: This is the fourth World Series in six years for the Houston Astros. Playing the underdog role are the Philadelphia Phillies.

question_sentence: Which company said it will soon seek approval for the first vaccine to prevent respiratory syncytial virus — or RSV?
evidence: Pfizer said it will seek FDA approval this year for a vaccine to prevent RSV, a common respiratory virus that typically causes mild, cold-like symptoms. Worldwide, RSV causes about 33 million infections in children under the age of 5 and hospitalizes 3.6 million annually.

question_sentence: Benzene, a cancer-causing chemical, was recently detected in several batches of which common household product?
evidence: Certain dry shampoos – including some Dove, Nexxus, Suave, TIGI and TRESemmé products – were voluntarily recalled because of the potential presence of benzene. This week, a new report from an independent laboratory called the levels of benzene in the products “troubling.”

question_sentence: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband, Paul Pelosi, was recently attacked in a violent home break-in. In which city did the attack occur?
evidence: After being attacked at his San Francisco residence, Paul Pelosi is “making steady progress on what will be a long recovery process,” Speaker Pelosi said in a statement. Court documents released this week showed that the man arrested in the assault allegedly awoke Paul Pelosi by standing over his bedside.

question_sentence: Which “extremely rare” item is expected to fetch up to $30 million at an upcoming auction?
choices: First-edition copy of the US Constitution
evidence: A first-edition copy of the US Constitution will go under the hammer in New York next month, Sotheby’s said. The announcement comes less than a year after the only other privately-held copy fetched a record $43.2 million at auction.

question_sentence: Which animals slipped loose from their enclosure at a Sydney zoo this week, prompting a full lockdown?
evidence: Some guests were rushed to safety after five lions managed a brief escape from their enclosure at Sydney’s Taronga Zoo. No people or animals were injured in the incident.

question_sentence: Which of the following was awarded the world’s best cheese for 2022?
evidence: This year’s winner, a gruyere from Switzerland, rose above more than 4,400 cheeses to claim the title.

question_sentence: The World Series has seen only 2 no-hitters. The Astros threw the second, dominating the Phillies in Game 4 this week. Which team had the first?
Takeoff, one-third of rap group Migos, died at age 28 in a Houston shooting on Halloween. Which is a Migos song?
Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva defeated Jair Bolsonaro in Brazil’s presidential runoff election. Lula da Silva was also president in:
The Brooklyn Nets fired head coach Steve Nash this week. Which of these players did not play for him during his tenure?
Which of these celebrities hasn’t announced their departure from Twitter following Elon Musk’s purchase of the platform?
The Federal Reserve announced a new interest rate hike this week. Which of these may actually become more affordable with the rate hike?
Country singer Luke Bryan received backlash on social media after bringing out which politician at a show?
Republican Ohio Senate candidate J.D. Vance is the author of which book?
Actor Matthew Perry’s debut memoir was released on Nov. 1. The actor is best known for which sitcom?
Starbucks’ holiday menu is back! This drink was introduced last year and has returned for the season.
Matt Hancock has been suspended from the Tory party after signing up to take part in which reality TV show?
evidence: The former health secretary’s decision to miss up to three weeks of Parliament to film the show in the Australian jungle was condemned by his local West Suffolk Conservative Association as ‘a serious error of judgement’

question_sentence: Denmark’s Social Democrats have clung on to power after securing what percentage of the vote in this week’s general election?
evidence: Mette Frederiksen will serve as prime minister for a second term after the centre-left bloc that she leads secured the 90 seats needed for a majority

question_sentence: Elon Musk is proposing to charge Twitters users how much per month to keep their blue tick verification?
evidence: Although the fee was initially expected to be $20, Musk is still facing widespread criticism over his plans for his newly acquired social media platform

question_sentence: Which of the following has been named Word of the Year for 2022 by Collins Dictionary?
evidence: The dictionary said the portmanteau ‘sums up quite succinctly just how truly awful 2022 has been for so many people’. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Demonstrators in Halloween costumes marched in cities across the UK last weekend to protest against what?
evidence: The ‘March of the Mummies’ national protest was organised by Pregnant Then Screwed, a charity that campaigns for better financial support for parents

question_sentence: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has reclaimed the Brazilian presidency after previously holding the role when?
evidence: Widely known as Lula, the leftist leader narrowly defeated incumbent Jair Bolsonaro in the run-off election by securing 50.9% of the vote

question_sentence: What did model Heidi Klum dress up as for her latest annual Halloween party?
evidence: Klum told reporters that she felt ‘quite claustrophobic’ in her full-body costume for the bash in New York City, where she was flanked by her musician husband Tom Kaulitz as a fisherman with a gouged-out eye

question_sentence: Ministers have reportedly ‘war gamed’ emergency plans to deal with what potential scenario this winter?
evidence: According to The Guardian, official documents warned that in a ‘reasonable worst-case scenario’ of a power outage, all sectors could be ‘severely disrupted’ for up to a week

question_sentence: Recent visitors to Shanghai Disney Resort got trapped inside the park for what reason?
choices: A search for a missing child
