evidence: Footage showed visitors rushing to the gates only to find them locked, as the park enforced China’s strict zero-Covid policy on Monday following an outbreak in the city

question_sentence: Which of the following high-profile figures has said they will not be attending Cop27?
evidence: The teenage eco-activist has described the UN climate summit, which kicks off on Sunday in Egypt, as a ‘scam’ that allows ‘greenwashing, lying and cheating’ to continue

question_sentence: The high-stakes midterm elections were held this week. In which key state did Democrats flip a Senate seat the GOP had held for more than a decade?
evidence: Democrats will pick up a Senate seat in Pennsylvania, CNN projects, with Democrat John Fetterman defeating Republican Mehmet Oz.

question_sentence: Many Florida residents who are still recovering from Hurricane Ian were hit this week by a tropical storm. What was the name of the storm?
evidence: Tropical Storm Nicole made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane in Florida on Thursday before weakening. The storm knocked out power for hundreds of thousands of residents and prompted the closure of many schools and the cancellation of hundreds of flights.

question_sentence: Which tech giant announced that shipments of a popular product lineup will be “temporarily impacted” by Covid restrictions in China?
evidence: One of Apple’s assembly facilities located in the central Chinese city of Zhengzhou is “currently operating at significantly reduced capacity” due to Covid curbs. As a result, Apple said it is expecting delays in shipments of its iPhone 14 models.

question_sentence: Which country’s lawmakers have urged state officials to “show no leniency” to protesters as thousands of people continue to rally on the streets?
evidence: Iranian lawmakers called for protesters to be taught a “good lesson” to deter others who threaten the authority of the Iranian government. The Islamic Republic is facing one of the biggest shows of dissent ever following the death of Mahsa Amini.

question_sentence: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced layoffs this week. Approximately how many employees were affected at the parent company of Facebook?
evidence: Meta’s job cuts will impact 11,000 employees and mark the first broad headcount reductions in the company’s history, Zuckerberg wrote in a blog post to employees. The significant layoffs at Meta come just days after Twitter, Lyft and Amazon also announced sweeping job cuts or pauses in hiring.

question_sentence: A single winning ticket for the record $2.04 billion Powerball lottery jackpot was sold this week in which state?
evidence: The lone winning ticket was sold in Altadena, California, lottery officials said Tuesday, making one lucky person the winner of the largest lottery prize ever.

question_sentence: US women’s basketball star Brittney Griner was transferred to a Russian penal colony this week. How many years is she due to serve for her drug smuggling sentence?
evidence: Griner is currently due to serve a nine-year sentence in Russia. This week, she was transferred to a penal colony where inmates are often subjected to tedious manual labor – such as sewing uniforms for the Russian army or making buttonholes for garments.

question_sentence: For a brief period this week, which color did Twitter use as its new “official” check mark to verify government accounts, media, and major brands?
evidence: After receiving widespread criticism over its plan to change the meaning of its blue check mark, the platform briefly debuted a gray check mark to label government accounts, major brands and media outlets. However, hours after it was introduced, Elon Musk changed his mind and rolled back the feature.

question_sentence: Which state approved a ballot measure this week that will legalize recreational marijuana?
evidence: CNN projects that Maryland — along with Missouri — will approve measures to legalize recreational marijuana use, while voters in Arkansas, North Dakota and South Dakota rejected similar measures. In Maryland specifically, individuals who were previously convicted of cannabis possession and intent to distribute will be able to apply for record expungement.

question_sentence: The CDC issued a warning this week about a deadly listeria outbreak in six states. Which food items were linked to the outbreak?
evidence: An outbreak of listeria has been linked to contaminated deli meat and cheese. A total of 16 people across the US have been infected, and 13 have been hospitalized, according to reports from six states.

question_sentence: Which state will hold a runoff election for a U.S. Senate seat, after neither candidate cleared the 50% threshold to win outright?
After firing head coach Frank Reich, which franchise legend did the Indianapolis Colts hire as interim head coach?
Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech are looking to combine a COVID-19 shot with a vaccine for which disease?
What did TSA agents find stuffed inside a traveler's raw chicken at an airport in Florida?
In which state was Democrat Maura Healey elected as the nation's first openly lesbian governor?
Season 5 of “The Crown” was released this week on Netflix. Who plays Princess Diana in the series?
Chris Evans was voted People’s Sexiest Man Alive for 2022. What role did he play in a Pixar movie?
Democrat Maxwell Frost made history when he became the first member of Gen Z to be elected to Congress. How old is Frost?
A growing body of research has linked a pregnant person's frequent use of this drug to autism and ADHD in their child.
The World Cup roster for the United States men’s national team was announced this week. Where is the World Cup being held?
Ron DeSantis won what percentage of the vote in the US midterm elections this week to secure re-election as governor of Florida?
evidence: The huge win against Democrat Charlie Crist ‘positions DeSantis for a potential 2024 presidential campaign’, said Vox.

question_sentence: An LGBTQ+ football supporters group has criticised which former England player for becoming a paid ambassador for the 2022 Qatar World Cup?
evidence: Three Lions Pride’s co-founder said that the LGBTQ+ ‘football family’ had previously put the former England captain ‘on a pedestal’ and considered him ‘a great ally’. Beckham will reportedly make £150m from the deal.

question_sentence: In a world-first clinical trial, how many people this week received transfusions of lab-grown red blood cells?
evidence: Scientists hope to be able to manufacture ultra-rare blood groups for patients with sickle cell anaemia and others with very specific requirements.

question_sentence: Shadow immigration minister Stephen Kinnock said this week that Labour is looking ‘very, very carefully’ at a scheme for what?
choices: Making voting in elections a legal requirement
Rolling out ID cards for UK citizens
evidence: After Kinnock made the comments to Times Radio, shadow home secretary Yvette Cooper shot down the idea of reviving the Blair-era policy on BBC Radio 4’s Today programme.

question_sentence: Which Tory MP is not reported to be on Boris Johnson’s resignation honours list?
evidence: The list has proved controversial after The Times reported that Johnson put forward two former advisers, Charlotte Owen and Ross Kempsell, to become the youngest-ever life peers.

question_sentence: Using artificial intelligence, a computer scientist believes he has identified a man who is an exact match for Lord Lucan, the murderer who disappeared in 1974. Where is he living?
evidence: An algorithm ran 4,000 cross-checks of photos of the pensioner and Lucan. Professor Hassan Ugail said they were the same individual or like ‘identical twins’.

question_sentence: A study published this week found that which animal tends to break up conflicts between other members of its own species?
evidence: After studying more than 100 pigs in Italy, researchers found they are likely to intervene in a conflict between other pigs to help smooth things over.

question_sentence: Which company has been criticised by privacy campaign group Big Brother Watch for allegedly facilitating stalking?
evidence: PimEyes has said its facial recognition technology is ‘not intended for the surveillance of others’, and claims to be safer than social media sites with regards to stalking. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: England is set to gain how many constituencies as a result of boundary changes to the UK’s political map?
evidence: Scotland would lose two seats and Wales would lose eight as a result of changes that could turn a number of safe seats into marginal battlegrounds.

question_sentence: What did the selection committee that decides the annual DreamToys shortlist say was a ‘strong consideration’ this year?
evidence: Paul Reader, chair of the DreamToys selection committee, said that toys’ prices had been taken into account, as 2022 has been a ‘challenging year for many families’.

question_sentence: Which high-profile Republican announced a 2024 White House bid this week?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump announced that he will run for president in 2024. He is widely expected to be challenged by both conservative and moderate Republicans who could announce their campaigns in the coming months.

question_sentence: Around 800 people on board a cruise ship recently tested positive for which virus?
evidence: A major Covid-19 outbreak on Carnival’s Majestic Princess prompted its operators to dock in Sydney, Australia, to allow hundreds of people off the ship. Those who tested positive were advised to complete a five-day isolation period.

question_sentence: Elon Musk appeared in court this week to defend the compensation package he received as Tesla’s CEO. How much is his pay package worth?
evidence: The net value of Elon Musk’s compensation package as the CEO of Tesla is $51 billion, making it the biggest for anyone on Earth from a publicly traded company.

question_sentence: Regulators hit six airlines with millions in fines for delayed refunds to passengers during the Covid-19 pandemic. Which is the only US airline to face the fines?
evidence: Ultra low-cost carrier Frontier Airlines is the only US airline to face fines related to refunds. Carriers based in other countries face the majority of fines: Air India, TAP Portugal, Aeromexico, El Al and Avianca.

question_sentence: Republicans will win the House of Representatives, CNN projects. How many seats were needed to gain control of the chamber?
evidence: The GOP passed the threshold of 218 seats needed for control of the chamber eight days after Election Day.

question_sentence: NASA launched its historic Artemis I mission on Wednesday. Where is the uncrewed spacecraft headed?
evidence: The Artemis I mission is paving the way for NASA to return astronauts to the moon for the first time in 50 years.

question_sentence: A federal judge recently moved to block a rule that allowed US authorities to expel more than a million migrants at the US-Mexico border. What is the rule called?
evidence: A judge issued an order blocking Title 42, a controversial Trump-era border policy. President Joe Biden, however, has requested a stay on the ruling, which will now be on hold until December 21.

question_sentence: World leaders are attempting to defuse a potential escalation in the monthslong Ukraine war after a Russian-made missile landed in which NATO country this week?
evidence: The missile that landed in Poland this week was likely fired by Ukrainian forces defending their country against a barrage of Russian strikes, Polish and NATO officials said, adding the incident appeared to be an accident. The event marked the first time a NATO country has been directly hit during the conflict.

question_sentence: The world’s population reached a new milestone this week. Approximately how many people now live on Earth?
evidence: The world’s population has reached 8 billion people, according to a projection from the UN. “This unprecedented growth is due to the gradual increase in human lifespan owing to improvements in public health, nutrition, personal hygiene and medicine. It is also the result of high and persistent levels of fertility in some countries,” the UN said.

question_sentence: A ferocious lake-effect snowstorm took aim at which state this week?
evidence: Excessive snowfall in and around Buffalo and Watertown, New York, was expected to shut down roads and paralyze cities for days, the National Weather Service said on Thursday.

question_sentence: Nancy Pelosi announced on Thursday that she would be stepping down from Speaker of the House. When did Pelosi first become speaker?
Millions of fans (and bots) flooded Ticketmaster's presale for Taylor Swift's next tour, causing the website to crash. What is the tour called?
Thousands of Starbucks workers went on strike on one of the company's busiest days of the year. The walkout coincided with which promotion?
It took eight days past Election Day, but control of the House of Representatives was finally decided. Which party secured the majority?
Beyoncé racked up 9 Grammy Award nods this week, bringing her total to 88. Which artist does she tie with for the most Grammy nominations ever?
This former Seahawks and 49ers cornerback is now an essential studio analyst on Amazon Prime Video’s Thursday Night Football.
Vandals destroyed fencing at a fur farm in northwest Ohio this week, releasing what from their cages?
Donald Trump announced he will run for president in 2024. Legal experts say being a candidate does not protect Trump from criminal prosecution.
Actress Christina Applegate received her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame this week. On which '90s sitcom did she star as Kelly Bundy?
Disney World is raising ticket prices for the first time since 2019. How much did adult admission cost when the Magic Kingdom opened in 1971?
Egypt has hosted Cop27 but where is the annual climate summit to be held next year?
evidence: The UN’s next Climate Change Conference (Cop28) is due to take place in Dubai from 30 November to 12 December 2023

question_sentence: Which music star has lost a bid to become officially recognised as the ‘Queen of Christmas’?
evidence: The US Patent and Trademark Office rejected the singer’s application after her company did not respond to another artist’s opposition. Elizabeth Chan, who specialises in festive music, launched a legal bid to block the trademark in August

question_sentence: Scientists studying the structure of neutron stars have compared the celestial objects to which sweet treats?
evidence: Researchers at Goethe University in Frankfurt made the comparison to the chocolate pralines after using hundreds of thousands of equations to define the stars’ structure from the stellar surface to the inner core

question_sentence: Which of Donald Trump’s children has said they do not want to be involved in his 2024 presidential bid?
evidence: Ivanka was a top White House advisor during her father’s time as president, but she ‘would never go back to that life’, a source close to the family reportedly told CNN

question_sentence: Which staple of the full English breakfast is being rationed in some UK supermarkets and pubs?
evidence: With bird flu and soaring production costs causing supply problems, eggs have been removed from fry-ups in a number of Wetherspoon pubs. Supermarkets including Asda and Lidl are putting limits on how many eggs customers can buy

question_sentence: Which top Tory this week requested an independent investigation into bullying allegations against them?
evidence: Deputy Prime Minister Raab wrote to Rishi Sunak asking for an independent inquiry into himself after being accused of aggressive behaviour towards staff during his reigns at the Foreign Office and the Ministry of Justice

question_sentence: According to the UN, the world’s population reached how many billion this week?
evidence: The global population reached an estimated 8bn on 15 November and is projected to climb to 9.7bn by 2050

question_sentence: Which of the following social media platforms reportedly gained 70,000 users overnight after Elon Musk’s controversial Twitter takeover?
evidence: Fed-up former tweeters have been flocking to Twitter rivals including Mastodon, which is billed as ‘a network of millions of users in independent communities that can all interact with one another’

question_sentence: What percentage of British voters now think the UK was right to leave the EU, according to a new YouGov poll?
evidence: The survey of more than 1,700 people found that 56% now think Britain was wrong the quit the bloc, while 13% were undecided

question_sentence: Cases of gonorrhoea and chlamydia in England are rising quickest among which age group, according to a new report?
evidence: A newly published Local Government Association report said that the number of over-65s who caught common STIs rose from 2,280 in 2017 to 2,748 in 2019, an increase of 20%

question_sentence: President Joe Biden pardoned the National Thanksgiving Turkey and its alternate this week. What are the turkeys’ names?
The 2022 FIFA World Cup kicked off in Qatar this week. Where will the next tournament be held in 2026?
In a move that hasn't been attempted since 1972, what operation did NASA's Artemis I Orion spacecraft complete this week?
choices: A flyby on the far side of the moon

question_sentence: What critically endangered bird was spotted in Papua New Guinea for the first time in 140 years?
President Joe Biden celebrated a milestone birthday this week. What is his age?
After a prodigious storm pounded parts of New York, how much snow was reported in Orchard Park, home of the NFL's Buffalo Bills?
This superstar closed out their final North American tour at Dodger Stadium this week, where they first performed over 47 years ago:
After stepping down two years ago, Bob Iger will return as CEO of which company?
With his wider plan tied up in court, President Joe Biden said this week the payment freeze would be extended for which type of loan?
A Grand Canyon campground was renamed after the Havasupai Tribe requested the "offensive name" be changed. What is it now called?
This week kicked off a solid start to the holiday shopping season. Following Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which was observed on Tuesday?
evidence: After snagging major deals, many shoppers participated in Giving Tuesday – a day of heightened generosity when people give to their favorite charities. About $3.1 billion dollars was raised for various causes this year, according to GivingTuesday.org.

question_sentence: What caused delays and headaches for millions of travelers across the US this week?
evidence: A severe storm system delayed thousands of flights as many people tried to fly back from their Thanksgiving destinations. A “particularly dangerous situation” tornado watch was also in effect for parts of three southern states.

question_sentence: Unprecedented protests over Covid-19 lockdowns recently took place in which country?
evidence: Thousands of people in China took to the streets in a rare show of dissent against the ruling Communist Party over its zero-Covid policies. Some have even called for the resignation of Chinese leader Xi Jinping.

question_sentence: The Senate on Tuesday passed legislation to protect same-sex and interracial marriage. How many Republicans supported the bill?
evidence: The bill was supported by all members of the Democratic caucus and 12 Republicans, the same dozen GOP members who backed the bill for a procedural vote earlier this month. The final vote was 61-36.

question_sentence: Which city issued a boil water notice to millions of its residents due to a loss of pressure at a purification plant?
evidence: City officials in Houston this week said water for drinking, cooking, washing hands and faces and brushing teeth should be boiled before use to destroy all potentially harmful bacteria and other microbes. The notice was lifted on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which country did the US Men’s National Team recently defeat in a high-stakes World Cup match?
evidence: The US advanced to the knockout stage after a hard-fought victory against Iran this week.

question_sentence: The world’s largest active volcano is erupting for the first time in nearly 40 years. Where is it located?
evidence: The Mauna Loa volcano is erupting on Hawaii’s Big Island. There is no threat to property, but state health officials have warned about potential air quality issues, including vog, or volcanic smog.

question_sentence: Which word did Merriam-Webster select as its 2022 word of the year?
evidence: The online dictionary chose the word “gaslighting,” which defines as “the act or practice of grossly misleading someone especially for one’s own advantage.”

question_sentence: Which global leader did President Joe Biden welcome to the White House this week for his first state visit since taking office?
evidence: French President Emmanuel Macron and his spouse, Brigitte Macron, arrived at the White House Thursday for a state visit. The Macrons’ trip to the White House marks their second time as the guests of honor for a state visit, having first done so during former President Donald Trump’s administration in 2018.

question_sentence: Which luxury fashion brand faced widespread criticism for publishing a controversial photo campaign involving children?
evidence: A Balenciaga photo shoot caused uproar for featuring children in a disturbing advertising campaign. Several high-profile celebrities are now reconsidering their working relationships with the brand.

question_sentence: This luxury fashion house drew backlash for referencing child porn and featuring child models alongside fetish imagery in a recent ad campaign:
Hawaii’s Mauna Loa, the largest active volcano in the world erupted this week for the first time since:
A Florida woman filed a class action lawsuit against Kraft Heinz Foods Company, alleging what about its Velveeta Shells & Cheese?
choices: It takes longer than advertised to prepare
The cheese doesn't stick to the shells

question_sentence: Protesters in Shanghai called for the removal of Chinese President Xi Jinping and clashed with police over policy relating to:
Which of these foods received UN world heritage status this week?
On Saturday, Michigan football defeated Ohio State in Columbus for the first time since:
Democratic Rep. Hakeem Jeffries will be the first Black lawmaker to lead a major party in Congress. He is a representative for which state?
Christine McVie, the British keyboard player and co-vocalist in Fleetwood Mac, died Wednesday at age 79. When did she join Fleetwood Mac?
South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem issued an executive order blocking the download of which app from state devices?
To avoid a strike that President Joe Biden warned would decimate the economy, Congress voted to impose a labor deal for which industry?
Which former Labour heavyweight hinted at a return to frontline politics during an interview with Andrew Marr?
evidence: It’s been more than a decade since David Miliband narrowly lost his bid for the Labour Party leadership to his brother, Ed.

question_sentence: According to the latest census data, what percentage of people in England and Wales consider themselves to have ‘no religion’?
evidence: The 2021 census also revealed that the proportion of people in England and Wales who describe themselves as Christian has fallen below 50% for the first time.

question_sentence: Why did four monks leave a Buddhist temple in Thailand this week?
choices: They had unauthorised visitors to stay
evidence: The monks tested positive for methamphetamine and were sent to a nearby clinic to undergo drug rehabilitation. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: According to British Poultry Council figures, how many free range turkeys and geese have been culled or died as a result of avian flu?
evidence: It was reported this week that almost half of the UK’s 1.3 million free range birds have been lost to avian flu.

question_sentence: Which classic video game turned 50 years old this week?
evidence: Pong, which would become the first commercially successful video game, was released by gaming giant Atari half a century ago.

question_sentence: The first by-election since the resignation of Boris Johnson and Liz Truss took place in Chester following the resignation of which Labour MP?
evidence: Labour held the seat with Samantha Dixon securing 61% of the votes. Chris Matheson resigned in October following allegations of sexual misconduct.

question_sentence: The UK’s most senior police officer of colour compared which Conservative Party cabinet member’s remarks about immigration to Enoch Powell’s views?
evidence: Neil Basu, who is stepping down after 30 years with the Metropolitan Police, told Channel 4 News that the home secretary’s vocabulary was ‘inexplicable’ and ‘horrific’.

question_sentence: A study found that Brexit has contributed to record price inflation, adding roughly how much to household food bills over the two years to the end of 2021?
evidence: The study by LSE researchers found that costs associated with leaving the EU had added 3% a year to UK food prices.

question_sentence: Which world-famous singer apologised after using a machine to produce ‘hand-signed’ copies of his new book?
evidence: Fans who had purchased limited-edition copies of Bob Dylan’s new book, The Philosophy of Modern Song, noticed the signatures were identical after comparing photographs online.

question_sentence: Christine McVie died this week aged 79. Which of these Fleetwood Mac hits did she not write?
evidence: The British-born singer-songwriter was the band’s ‘biggest hitmaker’ who also wrote You Make Loving Fun and Everywhere.

question_sentence: Which state was impacted by targeted gun attacks on power substations this week, leaving around 45,000 people in the dark?
evidence: Two substations in Moore County, North Carolina, were damaged by gunfire. The primary utility company in the county was able to restore power to residents after about four days without electricity.

question_sentence: Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock won Georgia’s Senate runoff this week, defeating Republican challenger Herschel Walker. Prior to leaping into politics, which sport did Herschel Walker play professionally?
evidence: Herschel Walker, who played college football at the University of Georgia, spent 12 seasons in the NFL. He later launched his Senate campaign with an endorsement from former President Donald Trump.

question_sentence: Authorities in Hawaii are concerned that lava from the Mauna Loa volcano eruption could soon reach which type of infrastructure?
evidence: The lava is less than two miles from reaching the Daniel K. Inouye Highway – the major highway connecting the eastern and western halves of the Big Island. If this occurs, it will cause major travel delays, but experts say it is unlikely that Mauna Loa’s lava will wipe out homes; the closest major population center is about 37 miles away.

question_sentence: Actor Bob McGrath died this week at age 90. Which beloved children’s show did he appear on for 47 seasons?
evidence: McGrath played the friendly neighbor Bob Johnson as an original cast member of “Sesame Street.” He joined the show in 1969. McGrath peacefully died at home, surrounded by loved ones, his family shared in a statement this week.

question_sentence: Which slang term was selected as Oxford’s word of the year for 2022?
evidence: The term “Goblin mode” was selected by 93% of people in a public poll, racking up nearly 320,000 votes. It refers to a type of behavior that is “unapologetically self-indulgent, lazy, slovenly, or greedy, typically in a way that rejects social norms or expectations.”

question_sentence: Which company recently cut ties with basketball star Kyrie Irving?
evidence: Nike has parted ways with Irving after the basketball player shared a link to a documentary containing antisemitic messages in October and initially refused to issue an apology.

question_sentence: Which country recently scrapped some of its most controversial Covid-19 rules that prompted protests across the country?
evidence: China unveiled 10 new guidelines that loosen some Covid restrictions – most notably, allowing home quarantine and phasing out the health QR code that has been mandatory for entering most public places.

question_sentence: More than 1,100 journalists and other staffers went on strike at which major newspaper this week?
evidence: New York Times journalists staged a historic 24-hour strike after management and the union representing staffers failed to reach a deal.

question_sentence: Dina Boluarte took office Wednesday to become the first female president of which country?
evidence: Dina Boluarte became the new president — and first female president — of Peru after the country’s Congress ousted former president Pedro Castillo.

question_sentence: Who was named TIME magazine’s person of the year for 2022?
evidence: Volodymyr Zelensky, the Ukrainian leader whose attempt to fight off Russia’s invasion of his country has won widespread acclaim, was named TIME magazine’s person of the year, alongside “the spirit of Ukraine.”

question_sentence: Aaron Judge agreed to re-sign with the New York Yankees this week, with a 9-year contract worth how much?
Democrat Raphael Warnock defeated Republican Herschel Walker in the Georgia Senate run-off. His win gives Democrats how many Senate seats?
Who was named Time’s 2022 Person of the Year this week?
Which of these people weren’t one of Google’s 10 top trending actor searches in 2022?
Rob Glass is the first football strength coach to eclipse an annual salary of $1 million at a public school. Where does he coach?
Brittney Griner was released from a Russian penal colony after a prisoner exchange for arms dealer Viktor Bout. How long was Griner detained?
“Harry & Meghan,” a docuseries centered on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, was released this week on which streaming platform?
The U.S. House Committee on Ethics is investigating a complaint concerning which representative?
Which virus is not included in the “tripledemic” that remains a problem in many places?
The House passed historic legislation this week that would federally protect same-sex and interracial marriage rights. What is it called?
What is the nickname of World Cup quarter-finalists Morocco?
evidence: Morocco knocked out Spain (3-0 on penalties) to reach the World Cup quarter-final. They face Portugal tomorrow.

question_sentence: The Oxford English Dictionary has named which word or phrase as its “word of the year”?
evidence: The Oxford English Dictionary defines goblin mode as “a type of behaviour which is unapologetically self-indulgent, lazy, slovenly, or greedy, typically in a way that rejects social norms or expectations”.

question_sentence: What is the average yearly pay for an author in the UK, according to a new report?
evidence: In 2006, the median earnings from self-employed writing was £12,330, but that has fallen by 60%, according to a report by the Authors’ Licensing and Collecting Society.

question_sentence: What is the average yearly pay for an author in the UK, according to a new report?
evidence: In 2006, the median earnings from self-employed writing was £12,330, but that has fallen by 60%, according to a report by the Authors’ Licensing and Collecting Society.

question_sentence: New York City mayor Eric Adams is looking for a citizen with “a general aura of badassery” in order to fill which vital role?
evidence: The city is advertising for a “somewhat bloodthirsty” person comfortable with “wholesale slaughter” to become its director of rodent mitigation – dubbed the  “rat czar” by some newspapers. The salary range is $120,000 to $170,000.

question_sentence: Where was the EU-Western Balkans summit held this week?
evidence: Despite constructive talks between the EU and the six countries outside the bloc, concrete progress on joining the EU remained elusive at the day-long summit in Tirana.

question_sentence: Which former PM hit the headlines this week with their plan for constitutional reform?
evidence: Brown’s 40-point plan for overhauling the constitution has been a labour of love since 2020 when he was first commissioned by Labour leader Keir Starmer.

question_sentence: Ukrainian embassies across the world have received packages containing which grizzly item?
evidence: There have been 31 “suspicious or threatening” items sent to embassies in 15 countries. Ukraine’s foreign minister initially pointed the finger of blame at Moscow, but Kyiv now believes the packages may have originated from Germany.

question_sentence: How many people of working age in the UK are currently “economically inactive” according to data from the Office for National Statistics?
evidence: The figures mean that around one in five of the working-age population is not currently in work. Around 2.5m people reported long-term sickness as the main reason for economic inactivity, up from around 2m in 2019.

question_sentence: Which two former cabinet members announced they were stepping down at the next UK general election?
evidence: The pair are two of a number of younger Conservative MPs and former rising stars of the party who have announced their decision to stand down amid poor polling for the Conservatives.

question_sentence: Which world-famous Manchester music venue is at risk of closure following a noise complaint by a neighbour?
evidence: The venue is appealing a noise abatement notice, which was served after a neighbour in an adjoining flat to the venue complained about loud music being played into the early hours of the morning.

question_sentence: Into which ocean did NASA’s Orion spacecraft splash down this week, marking the conclusion of the historic Artemis I mission?
evidence: The spacecraft completed its 25½-day journey around the moon by splashing down in the Pacific Ocean off Mexico’s Baja California.

question_sentence: Which teams faced off in the 2022 World Cup final?
evidence: Argentina played France on Sunday to determine who won the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

question_sentence: US scientists made a remarkable breakthrough this week. What did their discovery involve?
evidence: For the first time, US scientists successfully produced a nuclear fusion reaction resulting in a net energy gain. The discovery is a massive step forward in a decades-long quest for a new form of clean energy that could eventually power homes and help end dependence on fossil fuels.

question_sentence: According to a new study, Covid-19 vaccinations have saved approximately how many lives across the United States?
evidence: Covid-19 vaccines have kept more than 18 million people out of the hospital and saved more than 3 million lives since first becoming available in December 2020, according to researchers from the Commonwealth Fund and Yale School of Public Health.

question_sentence: Which grocery item are people panic buying across China?
evidence: An unprecedented wave of Covid-19 cases in China has sparked panic buying of fever medicines, pain killers, and even home remedies such as canned peaches.

question_sentence: Which state’s governor recently commuted the sentences for 17 death row inmates?
evidence: Outgoing Oregon Gov. Kate Brown commuted the sentences of 17 inmates, clearing the state’s death row and calling the death penalty “immoral.” The inmates will now spend life in prison without the possibility of parole, according to a statement from her office.

question_sentence: Which country passed a landmark anti-smoking bill this week, banning the sale of tobacco for today’s teens and future generations?
evidence: New Zealand passed a historic bill which bans the sale of tobacco to anyone born on or after January 1, 2009.

question_sentence: The federal government is suing Arizona for creating a makeshift wall to block gaps in the US-Mexico border. What had state officials used to construct it?
evidence: Outgoing Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey, a Republican, is contending with a major lawsuit filed by the Department of Justice after instructing state officials to use shipping containers to fill in gaps along the border.

question_sentence: Which billionaire recently lost his top spot as the richest man in world?
evidence: Elon Musk is no longer the richest person on the planet, dropping to the second spot behind French fashion mogul Bernard Arnault.

question_sentence: In recent weeks, at least seven states have said they will bar public employees from using which social media app on government devices?
evidence: TikTok, the popular short-form video app, is facing growing pushback at the state level over fears users’ personal information could wind up in the hands of the Chinese government.

question_sentence: Where was FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried arrested this week?
Legendary college football coach Mike Leach died this week. He coached at all of these schools except:
According to a new USA TODAY/Suffolk University poll, Republicans favor, 56% to 33%, which candidate over former President Donald Trump?
Which member of K-pop supergroup BTS began his mandatory military service at a boot camp this week?
Which city removed its final public Confederate monument this week?
President Joe Biden signed the "Respect for Marriage Act," this week. What does the historic legislation do at the federal level?
choices: Allows same-sex marriage in every state

question_sentence: Comedian Dave Chappelle brought out which person – to a chorus of boos and some cheers – on stage during a show this week?
A new technology soon being tested in Michigan could be the future of powering electric vehicles. What is it?
choices: Wind farm dedicated to EV charger power

question_sentence: True or false: President Biden has now released all the once-classified files on John F. Kennedy’s assassination.
Scientists made a major advance this week that could someday create clean, carbon-free power using what energy process?
Cambridge University plans to return which major artefact to its home country?
evidence: The university will return the looted Benin Bronzes to Nigeria. The artefacts were taken by British armed forces during the sacking of Benin City in 1897.

question_sentence: Which country has passed a bill that will ban the sale of tobacco to future generations?
evidence: Under new legislation set to be introduced next year, anyone born on or after 1 January 2009 will be unable to buy tobacco in New Zealand.

question_sentence: Who is now the world’s richest man after Elon Musk dropped from the top spot?
evidence: A dramatic drop in the value of Musk’s shares in Tesla saw Arnault, the chief executive of luxury goods group LVMH, claim the title.

question_sentence: What percentage of El Salvador’s population has been jailed under its ‘iron fist’ anti-gang policy?
evidence: President Nayib Bukele’s crackdown has put the nation in a prolonged state of emergency with important constitutional rights, like due process and freedom of association, being restricted.

question_sentence: In which country was former FTX cryptocurrency boss Sam Bankman-Fried arrested after charges were filed against him in the US?
evidence: Bankman-Fried will appear in court in the Bahamas, according to authorities in the Caribbean, after he was arrested for financial offences against laws in the US and the Bahamas.

question_sentence: Joe Biden has released previously secret FBI files about the assassination of which US president?
evidence: Thousands of classified documents relating to the assassination of John F. Kennedy in 1963 were released this week after Biden vowed to make them available to the public.

question_sentence: Temperatures have plummeted across the UK this week. Where was a record low of -15C recorded?
evidence: Cold weather has caused disruption across the UK this week, with meteorologists issuing warnings of ice and snow as temperatures plummeted way below freezing.

question_sentence: Which member of global K-pop superband BTS is to start his compulsory military service this week?
evidence: BTS plan to reunite in around three years’ time, when all seven members of the South Korean group will have completed their military service.

question_sentence: With France and Argentina set to battle it out on Sunday in the World Cup final, which teams will go head to head for third place?
evidence: After losing out in the semi-finals, Croatia and Morocco will now play each other in the third-place play-off on Saturday.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults would like to live to 100, according to a new poll?
evidence: According to a poll by Ipsos, 35% of Britons say they want to live to be 100 years old, while 49% disagree. Men are keener on the idea than women (43% to 28%).

question_sentence: How many Christmas trees are displayed throughout the White House this year?
evidence: There are 77 Christmas trees placed throughout the White House, with over 83,615 holiday lights decorating the trees as well as garlands, wreaths and displays. First lady Jill Biden chose “We the People” as the theme for the seasonal White House holiday decorations this year.

question_sentence: The world’s largest menorah was lit this week to mark the start of Hanukkah, the Jewish festival of lights. In which US city is the menorah located?
evidence: The 36-foot tall menorah was erected in Manhattan’s Grand Army Plaza in New York City. Israeli artist Yaacov Agam designed the structure.

question_sentence: Kwanzaa, the holiday when African-American families come together and celebrate their ancestral roots, is celebrated for how many days?
evidence: Kwanzaa lasts for seven days and is celebrated from December 26 to January 1. Each day is dedicated to the Nguzo Saba, also known as the seven principles: unity (umoja), self-determination (kujichagulia), collective responsibility (ujima), cooperative economics (ujamaa), purpose (nia), creativity (kuumba) and faith (imani).

question_sentence: Which is the most famous site for winter solstice celebrations in the United Kingdom?
evidence: The UK’s most famous site for solstice celebrations is Stonehenge. On the winter solstice, visitors traditionally enter the towering, mysterious stone circle for a sunrise ceremony run by local pagan and druid groups. Winter solstice marks the shortest day of year and the official first day of winter.

question_sentence: Which Christmas-time phenomenon involves a popular holiday product parents place around their home to “monitor” if kids are being naughty or nice?
evidence: Millions of families participate in the Elf on the Shelf tradition. Once placed on display on a shelf or other prominent spot in a family’s home, the elf goes on a journey at night (to visit Santa and report if kids in the household were naughty or nice that day, of course). That’s why it’s then found in a different spot the next morning. Just remember, you can’t touch the elf or it will lose its magic.

question_sentence: Which food do people in the American South often eat to attract good luck in the New Year? (Hint: It’s also traditionally served during Rosh Hashanah, the Jewish New Year.)
evidence: Once looked down on for their plainness and associated with poverty, black-eyed peas are now considered a lucky food, and thought to bring prosperity in the new year.

question_sentence: Singer Mariah Carey is always popular during the holiday season thanks to her hit song, “All I Want for Christmas Is You.” But which artist is behind the classic Latin jingle, “Feliz Navidad”?
evidence: Puerto Rican singer and songwriter José Feliciano released “Feliz Navidad” in 1970. It’s been a holiday staple ever since. Here are some other chart-topping holiday songs that have withstood the test of time.

question_sentence: Many Japanese families make a tradition of eating a Christmas meal at which fast food restaurant?
evidence: Fried chicken is a beloved Christmas tradition in Japan — especially in a bucket or “party barrel” from KFC. According to figures released by the American fast-food chain, KFC Japan brings in several millions of dollars from December 20 to 25, often with lines out the door in the days leading up to Christmas.

question_sentence: Some communities across Sweden celebrate the Yule season by setting a large straw animal on fire. Which type of animal is it?
evidence: The Yule Goat, or “Julbock**en,” is a common sight in Sweden around the winter solstice; and not just in giant, flammable form. Little ornament-sized versions are popular, too (and safer).

question_sentence: Junkanoo, a celebration that runs from December 26 through New Year’s Day, originated on what island nation?
evidence: Junkanoo parades have since cropped up in other parts of the Caribbean, but it is still considered a uniquely Bahamian tradition. Many Bahamanians trace the celebration back to the era when enslaved people used “days off” between Christmas and the New Year for roving parties.

question_sentence: After four weeks of soccer in Qatar, what team was crowned the World Cup champion this week?
True or false: Dec. 21's winter solstice marked the astronomical start of winter in the Northern Hemisphere, was the shortest day of the year.
After a lengthy legal battle, the House Ways and Means Committee voted to publicly release what information of Donald Trump's?
choices: Emails from his time as president

question_sentence: True or false: Elon Musk claimed he'll step down as CEO after asking Twitter users to vote in a poll on whether he should stay or go.
A Trump-era policy allowing quick expulsion of migrants on public health grounds was set to expire this week. What is the policy known as?
After a surge in incidents, the Transportation Security Administration is raising the fine for being caught with what in your carry-on?
NASA's groundbreaking InSight lander's mission came to an end this week after more than 4 years of exploring what planet?
A woman allegedly broke into the New York City home of this Oscar-winning actor and tried to steal presents from under his Christmas tree.
The creators of this animated series said the story of protagonist Ash Ketchum will end next year, as the focus shifts to new characters.
This Pro Football Hall of Famer, known for making the iconic “Immaculate Reception,” died this week at age 72.
Which US city was pummeled by a fierce blizzard this week?
evidence: A deadly winter storm buried Buffalo, New York, in up to 51.9 inches of snow, trapping residents at home over the Christmas weekend – many without heating as the storm took out power lines. It also made roadways impassable, stranding some in the snow under frigid temperatures.

question_sentence: Which airline suffered an operational meltdown this week that resulted in thousands of flights being canceled?
evidence: Southwest Airlines canceled thousands of flights this week, stranding passengers across the country. The carrier blamed the travel disaster on a combination of factors, including winter storm delays, aggressive flight scheduling and outdated infrastructure.

question_sentence: Which country announced this week that it’s dropping Covid-19 quarantine requirements for international arrivals after sealing its borders in March 2020?
evidence: China said will drop Covid-19 quarantine requirements for travelers beginning on January 8 – a major step toward reopening its borders that have shut off the country from the rest of the world for nearly three years.

question_sentence: According to a new analysis, what percentage of California is at risk for wildfires?
evidence: The climate crisis is among the key factors in a new assessment that shows more than 85% of California’s rural and unincorporated land is now in “high” or “very high” severity zones for wildfire danger, the state’s Department of Forestry and Fire Protection announced.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court issued an order related to which controversial subject this week?
evidence: The Supreme Court said Tuesday that the controversial Trump-era border restriction known as Title 42 will remain in effect while legal challenges play out, a move that ensures that federal officials will be able to continue to swiftly expel migrants at US borders at least for the next several months.

question_sentence: Speaking of migrants, approximately how many asylum applications are currently pending in the US immigration system?
evidence: Nearly 1.6 million asylum applications are pending in US immigration courts and at US Citizenship and Immigration Services – the largest number of pending asylum cases on record, according to an analysis of federal data.

question_sentence: According to price-tracker GasBuddy, how high are gas prices in the US expected to climb in 2023?
evidence: Gas prices will probably be significantly cheaper overall next year – yet the national average could still climb back above the $4-a-gallon threshold as soon as May, according to GasBuddy projections shared exclusively with CNN.

question_sentence: Kathy Whitworth, the professional golfer with the most wins in history, died at age 83 while celebrating Christmas Eve with family and friends. How many wins did she accumulate?
evidence: Whitworth had 88 wins on the LPGA Tour, including six major championships. Her 88 wins are six more than Sam Snead and Tiger Woods, who hold the record for the men’s tour.

question_sentence: Thousands of users were unable to access which social media platform this week?
evidence: Thousands of Twitter users in several countries struggled to access the platform Wednesday – even as an error message urged, “don’t fret… Let’s try again.” As intermittent outages spread, Twitter’s new owner Elon Musk said it “works for me.”

question_sentence: Scientists examining a slice of a massive meteorite have identified what?
evidence: Scientists have identified two minerals never before seen on Earth in a meteorite weighing 15.2 metric tons.

question_sentence: After the death of Queen Elizabeth II in September, who took the throne as the new British monarch?
This football star announced his retirement in February before changing his mind and announcing his return for another season.
Tom Cruise saw the biggest box office opening weekend of his career with this 2022 film.
Ketanji Brown Jackson made history this year when she became the first Black woman to hold what position?
This former Japanese prime minister was assassinated while delivering a campaign speech in July.
In October, Tesla CEO and billionaire Elon Musk officially purchased this company for $44 billion.
The first images from this observatory spacecraft wowed viewers when NASA revealed them in July.
What was the case in which SCOTUS overturned Roe v. Wade, the 1973 decision that established a constitutional right to an abortion?
choices: United States v. Planned Parenthood of Tennessee and North Mississippi

question_sentence: Agents from this federal law enforcement agency searched Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago home as part of an investigation over classified documents.
After a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's shaved head, Will Smith ran onstage and slapped Chris Rock at which awards show?
NFL player Damar Hamlin suffered an on-field medical emergency this week. He is a valued member of which team?
evidence: The 24-year-old Buffalo Bills player has shown “remarkable improvement” after suffering a cardiac arrest during Monday night’s football game, his team said in a statement Thursday. Players, coaches and fans across the NFL community are keeping their focus on his recovery.

question_sentence: Which former pope was laid to rest this week?
evidence: Pope Francis paid tribute this week to his predecessor, former Pope Benedict XVI, in a funeral attended by tens of thousands of mourners at St. Peter’s Square. Benedict, the first pontiff in almost 600 years to resign his position rather than hold office for life, died at age 95 on December 31 at a monastery in Vatican City.

question_sentence: Which seed did the FDA recently add to its list of major food allergens?
evidence: Sesame joined the list of major food allergens defined by law, meaning foods containing sesame will be subject to new labeling and manufacturing requirements. For several years, the FDA has been reviewing whether to put sesame seeds on the major food allergens list — which also includes milk, eggs, fish, crustacean shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat and soybeans.

question_sentence: Huge crowds lined the streets of which country this week to pay tribute to soccer great Pelé?
evidence: Hundreds of thousands of people poured in the city of Santos, Brazil, to view Pelé’s funeral procession this week. The three-time World Cup winner died last month at the age of 82 due to the progression of colon cancer.

question_sentence: Which airline announced it will give 25,000 frequent flier miles to passengers who were impacted by its holiday travel meltdown?
evidence: Some Southwest passengers who were affected by a wave of cancellations over the holidays are now receiving thousands of frequent flier miles as a “gesture of goodwill,” the company said.

question_sentence: Which Covid-19 variant of Omicron has become the most dominant in the US, causing the most new coronavirus cases?
evidence: Scientists have been monitoring a rise in several Omicron subvariants, but XBB.1.5 cases have shown the greatest spike, rising from about 4% to 41% of new infections over the month of December.

question_sentence: A bomb cyclone is slamming California this week, causing widespread flooding. Which part of the state is experiencing the storm’s heaviest rain?
evidence: The storm’s heaviest rain and strongest winds have wreaked havoc in the Bay Area just days after a different storm brought deadly floods.

question_sentence: Which company is the latest tech giant to announce significant layoffs?
evidence: Amazon plans to lay off more than 18,000 employees as the global economic outlook continues to worsen, the company announced this week.

question_sentence: The Republican Party has been at odds this week over who should become the next House speaker. Which GOP leader sparked a dayslong stalemate?
evidence: House Republicans disagreed for days over electing a speaker, with GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failing to secure the necessary support after multiple rounds of voting.

question_sentence: Which home goods chain recently said it has “substantial doubt” it can stay in business?
evidence: Bed Bath & Beyond recently issued a warning that a bankruptcy filing is a possible outcome for the company. There is “substantial doubt about the company’s ability to continue” because of its worsening financial situation, the home goods chain said in a regulatory filing Thursday.

question_sentence: The U.S. House was stuck in a stalemate over electing a new speaker this week. Which Republican suffered a string of defeats in multiple votes?
The Vatican held a funeral for a former pope this week for the first time in how many years?
The maximum value of the Pell Grant awarded to college students will be raised by how much in the 2023 fiscal year?
NFL safety Damar Hamlin was hospitalized this week after suffering a cardiac arrest during a game on Monday. What team does he play for?
True or false: Rolling Stone ruffled feathers with its updated 200 Greatest Singers of All Time list by snubbing powerhouses like Celine Dion.
Believed to be the old​​est person in the U.S., Bessie Hendricks died this week in Iowa. How old was she?
Which company is being sued for failing to pay rent at one of its offices in San Francisco?
Rapper Gangsta Boo, also known as Lola Mitchell, died this week at age 43. She got her start in the industry with which group?
Starting this week, travelers from which country now need to provide a negative COVID-19 test to enter the U.S.?
Up against the Chicago Bulls, Cleveland Cavaliers star Donovan Mitchell scored the eighth-most points in an NBA game. How many did he score?
In which European country is former reality TV star and online influencer Andrew Tate being held in pre-trial detention?
evidence: A Bucharest court agreed to a police request to extend Tate’s detention to 30 days following his arrest on charges of human trafficking, rape and forming an organised crime group

question_sentence: Prince Harry reportedly claims in his upcoming memoir Spare that his brother William did what during a row about Meghan Markle?
evidence: According to a leaked extract published by The Guardian, Harry claims William physically attacked him during a 2019 row that began after the future heir to the throne described Markle as ‘difficult’, ‘rude’ and ‘abrasive’

question_sentence: The recently deceased Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI was the first pope to resign from the role in how many centuries?
evidence: Benedict died last week at the age of 95, almost a decade after resigning because of ill health. He became the first pope to stand down since Gregory XII in 1415

question_sentence: Which virus is England set to eradicate almost five years ahead of a target set by the World Health Organization (WHO)?
evidence: The NHS is on track to eliminate the virus in the community by 2025. Targeted screening campaigns and effective drug treatments have reduced the number of deaths from Hepatitis C by 35% in the past five years

question_sentence: Japan’s government is to offer families how much to relocate from Tokyo to less densely populated areas?
evidence: Parents in the Japanese capital can already claim 300,000 yen (£1,900) per child to relocate, but the subsidy is set to triple from April. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: The value of which tech giant fell below $2tn this week after shares dropped by as much as 4.3%?
evidence: Mounting concerns over Apple’s global supply chain and a wider sell-off in America left the company’s value at $1.98tn, down from a peak of $3tn at the start of 2022

question_sentence: Which US state is represented by congressman Kevin McCarthy, the Republican leader whose bid to be voted House speaker was blocked by GOP hardliners this week?
evidence: McCarthy became the first majority leader in 100 years to lose an initial vote to be elected speaker of the House of Representatives, and suffered further defeats in a series of ballots after failing to win over Republican rebels

question_sentence: Who has returned to TV screens in the role of Sergeant Catherine Cawood in hit BBC series Happy Valley?
evidence: The third and final season of the popular crime drama debuted this week, seven years after the second season concluded

question_sentence: Which climate action group has announced plans to ‘quit’ in 2023?
evidence: The climate action group released a statement on New Year’s Day titled ‘We Quit’. The activists plan to temporarily shift away from public disruption and focus on building a wider movement

question_sentence: Newly released figures show that the amount of electricity produced by which type of renewable energy hit a record high in Britain last year?
evidence: The National Grid said that on a single day in November, more than 70% of electricity in Britain was produced by wind – ‘enough power to heat about 1700 homes for a year’,  the BBC reported

question_sentence: Which state has been drenched by a powerful storm this week, causing widespread flooding and power outages?
evidence: Back-to-back atmospheric rivers in California have dropped staggering amounts of rain on the state and left dozens of highways impassable.

question_sentence: Which three-digit phone number is going out of service for millions of Americans?
evidence: Beginning this month, AT&T customers with digital landlines won’t be able to dial 411 or 0 to get directory assistance or reach an operator. The company is instead directing customers to find addresses and phone numbers on Google or online directories.

question_sentence: Prince Harry published his highly anticipated memoir this week detailing some controversial claims about the British royal family. What is the book titled?
evidence: Prince Harry set a record with his tell-all memoir “Spare,” after the English language version sold more than 1.4 million copies on its first day of publication. The book’s title “Spare” is a reference to “heir and a spare,” a saying in the UK that the Duke of Sussex’s role is seen as the monarchy’s “spare heir.”

question_sentence: About 7,000 people went on strike in New York City this week arguing that immense staffing shortages have caused widespread burnout. Where do the strikers work?
evidence: A nurses strike at two major hospital systems in the city came to an end Thursday after thousands of nurses spent three days on the picket line.

question_sentence: Which political figure faced a barrage of questions this week after batches of classified documents were found in one of his former offices and in one of his homes?
evidence: President Joe Biden’s legal team found batches of classified government records that were incorrectly handled following his time as vice president. Classified documents are supposed to go to the National Archives when an administration ends.

question_sentence: Which awards show aired this week on the heels of diversity and ethics controversies?
evidence: The Golden Globe Awards returned to TV this week after a series of controversies drove the ceremony off the air last year. See the full list of nominees and winners here.

question_sentence: For the first time in 50,000 years, a rare comet is making an appearance in the night sky this week. Which color is it?
evidence: A dazzling green comet is making a swing by Earth this week. The comet has been visible through binoculars for sky-watchers in the Northern Hemisphere.

question_sentence: A top consumer regulator set off a firestorm this week by suggesting there could be a large-scale ban on which type of home appliance?
evidence: Consumer Product Safety Commissioner Richard Trumka Jr. said federal safety regulators are considering a ban on gas stoves. Following public outcry and confusion, President Biden weighed in on the matter, with a spokesperson telling CNN: “The President does not support banning gas stoves – and the Consumer Product Safety Commission, which is independent, is not banning gas stoves.”

question_sentence: Several grocery items are getting more expensive in the US, but nothing comes close to the rising cost of which popular food?
evidence: US egg supplies are currently constrained due to a deadly avian flu that is causing widespread shortages. This is drastically pushing up egg costs worldwide.

question_sentence: Which candy brand is facing criticism over one of its new packaging designs?
evidence: M&M’s is making a statement with its latest candy pack featuring an all-female set of characters. Some right-wing news networks, however, have expressed outrage about the design.

question_sentence: The Georgia Bulldogs romped past this opponent on Monday to win their second straight College Football Playoff championship.
Which Hollywood star was seen working at a Dunkin’ Donuts this week?
Hundreds of people were arrested in which country after government buildings in its capital city were attacked, vandalized and looted on Jan. 8?
At the North American Leaders’ Summit this week, President Joe Biden held bilateral talks with this leader, his Mexican counterpart:
About 100 Ukrainians will travel to which US state to learn how to use the Patriot missile defense system?
Who won the award for best actress in a musical or comedy at the Golden Globes this week?
All these MLB teams reportedly agreed to a contract with shortstop Carlos Correa this offseason except:
Burger chain In-N-Out announced this week it was expanding to which state?
Thousands of flights across the US were delayed Wednesday because of what at the Federal Aviation Administration?
The Mega Millions jackpot has increased to how much after no winner was announced on Tuesday?
According to UN-backed scientists, Earth’s ozone layer is on track to fully recover from human-made damage by when?
evidence: A new UN report predicts that our planet’s protective shield from the Sun’s harmful ultraviolet rays could recover to 1980s levels by 2066 over Antarctica, by 2045 over the Arctic and by 2040 over the rest of the world

question_sentence: Which three-Michelin-starred restaurant said to be the world’s best is closing because of ‘unsustainable’ economics?
evidence: Chef René Redzepi has helmed the Copenhagen restaurant since 2003 but said he would be forced to call it quits by the end of next year owing to soaring food and labour costs

question_sentence: New research found that MPs earned a total of how much from second jobs over the past three years?
evidence: According to the Westminster Accounts interactive database, launched by Sky News and Tortoise Media, around two-thirds of the extra earnings went to just 20 MPs, with Theresa May claiming the biggest share

question_sentence: Who won Best Director at the 2023 Golden Globes?
evidence: Spielberg’s semi-autobiographical film The Fabelmans was one of the big winners at this week’s awards ceremony, also bagging the Best Drama gong

question_sentence: Which high-profile billionaire has gained a place in the Guinness Book of World Records for ‘largest ever loss of personal wealth’?
evidence: Musk has reportedly lost $182bn since November 2021, largely owing to a steep drop in Tesla share prices. In December, he also lost his crown as the world’s richest person to Arnault, the boss of French fashion giant LVMH

question_sentence: Prince Harry’s memoir Spare broke sales records by selling how many copies in the UK on its release day?
evidence: Penguin Random House said the royal’s book sold more than 400,000 copies in the UK on Tuesday alone across hardback, ebook and audio formats, and around a million more in the US and Canada

question_sentence: Republican Kevin McCarthy was finally elected as speaker of the US House of Representatives after how many rounds of voting?
evidence: McCarthy was the first majority leader in a century to fail to be elected in the first ballot. He finally succeeded after making major concessions to ultra-conservative GOP lawmakers who had blocked his speaker bid

question_sentence: The UK’s first ever space mission failed after the Virgin Orbit rocket launched from where?
evidence: An ‘anomoly’ prevented Virgin Orbit’s LauncherOne rocket from blasting into orbit after lifting off from Newquay on Monday night under the arm of a modified jumbo jet

question_sentence: Around how many UK households are at risk of defaulting on their mortgages in the next two years, according to the nation’s financial regulator?
evidence: The Financial Conduct Authority said more than 200,000 households had already fallen behind on payments as of last June and a further 570,000 households were ‘at risk of payment shortfall’ within the next two years

question_sentence: Which Chinese city is set to offer cash incentives for residents to have more children?
evidence: Under plans aimed at reversing declining birth rates, the southern city’s 17.7m residents will be paid about £900 for starting a family, with additional payments of £1,300 and £2,300 respectively for second and third children
